title: fly_me_to_the_star_(revue_starlight)
body:
Posts that directly reference or parody frames from the [[Shoujo Kageki Revue Starlight]] TV Anime ending sequence, drawn by the artist [[Mebachi]].

References to the first half of the ED usually portrait [[floating]] or [[falling]] characters on a [[blurry background|blurry]] [[grey background]] with [[floating object|floating objects]], usually followed by a [[close-up]], although the first frames depict an [[upper body]] of character [[facing viewer|facing]] or [[looking at viewer]] if alone, or two characters [[face-to-face|facing]] and/or [[eye contact|looking at each other]].

The second half consist in a [[tall image]] with [[curtains]], a [[starry sky]] and characters lined up vertically, followed by a [[full body]] frame of the focus character(s) under the [[spotlight]].

h4. Notable examples
h6.First half
* !asset #25716646: A solo character ([[Kagura Hikari]]) [[facing viewer|facing]] and then [[looking at viewer]] - Ep.3
* !asset #25716660: Two characters ([[Kagura Hikari]] and [[Aijou Karen]]) [[face-to-face|facing]] and then [[eye contact|looking at each other]] - Ep.4
* !asset #25716700: Pair characters ([[Kagura Hikari]] and [[Aijou Karen]]) [[floating]]/[[falling]] - Ep.4
* !asset #25716392: [[close-up]] frame - Ep.4
h6.Second half
* !asset #25716517: Full lenght scroll with all the Seisho protagonists
* !asset #25716394: Ending frame with pair characters ([[Kagura Hikari]] and [[Aijou Karen]]) under the [[spotlight]] - Ep.4

title: michigami_nareko
body:
Stage 3 Boss of [[Fossilized Wonders]]. The "Dōsojin of the Enclosed Sanctuary". 

Has [[blue eyes]], [[blue tattoo|blue]] [[facial tattoos|facial tattoo]], [[key earrings]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with [[blunt bangs]] and [[quad tails]] bound in a [[gold jewelry|gold]] [[headpiece]]. Wears a [[gold armor|gold]] and [[blue armor|blue]] [[chest guard]], [[brown shirt|brown]] [[short sleeves|short sleeved]] shirt, [[brown shorts]] with a [[belt]], [[brown boots]] and [[black thighhighs]]. Wields a golden [[staff]] and [[scepter]].

title: gudaguda_teito_seihai_kitan
body:
[b]Isolated Realm of the Far East: Imperial Capital[br]GUDAGUDA Legend of the Imperial Capital Grail ~Far East Demonic Front 1945~[/b]
[quote]A peculiar Singularity has been observed in the year 1945, located in the Far East.
A new legend of the Holy Grail is woven after an encounter with a mysterious Heroic Spirit.
With the Imperial Capital mired in...shenanigans, a new Holy Grail War begins!

But what is it that now approaches this land: A god, or a demon...?[/quote]

A limited time event in [[Fate/Grand Order]] serving as a collaboration with [[Koha-Ace]], released on the Japanese server on June 13, 2018 and on the NA server on June 3, 2020. [[Sakamoto Ryouma (fate)|]] is given as a reward to players for completing the event.

title: mary_anning_(fate)
body:
Lancer-class servant appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She was one of the original servants in [[Riyo (lyomsnpmp)|]]'s ""Learn Even More with Manga! FGO":[/pools/10385]". She first appeared in post #3394140. She is based on the English archaeologist, fossil collector, dealer, and paleontologist with the same name. She is portrayed as a [[yuri|lesbian]] (with a notable obsession over [[Saber (fate)|]] specifically) as a result of the 2020 film "Ammonite":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ammonite_(film).

The "horns" on the sides of her head are actually two [[ammonite]] shells, as highlighted in her third ascension.

She is accompanied by her [[spaniel (dog)|]], Tray. Her [[Noble Phantasm (fate)|]] allows her to summon familiars based on extinct lifeforms, including the [[Plesiosaur]], [[Ichthyosaur]], [[Dimorphodon]], [[Ammonite]], and "Belemnite":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belemnitida.

[b]True Name:[/b] "Mary Anning":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_Anning
[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Riyo (lyomsnpmp)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Naganawa Maria]]

title: age_of_empires_ii
body:
The second game in the Age of Empires series, covering the time period between the dark ages (5th century) to the early renaissance (15th century). Originally focusing on civilizations of the Eurasian landmass, later expansion packs also covered civilizations of the Americas as well as Africa.

h4. See also

* [[Age of Empires (series)]]

title: chirizuka_ubame
body:
Stage 1 Boss of [[Fossilized Wonders]], and 'king' of the yamanba (mountain hags) like [[Sakata Nemuno]].

As it's implied that the yamanba have a heirarchy based on age, this implies Chirizuka is the oldest among them as well. With that said, yamanba by definition don't like the idea of making a society, so she rarely uses her power as 'king'.

title: babe_(fate)
body: [[paul bunyan (fate)|Paul Bunyan]]'s pet blue [[bull|ox]] that she rides around on for attacks.

title: houjuu_chimi
body:
Stage 2 Boss of [[Fossilized Wonders]]. An outsider who can only live in places with a lot of nature, like mountains, forests and rivers.

Though she shares a family name with [[Houjuu Nue]], (even having the same kanji - for comparison, [[Kishin Sagume]] and [[Kijin Seija]] do not) any direct relationship between the two is unknown.

title: walther_ppk
body:
The [b]Walther PP[/b] ([i]Polizeipistole[/i]) is a double-action semi-automatic [b][[handgun]][/b] of German origin, designed in 1929 and manufactured by Carl Walther GmbH Sportwaffen. Its compact size and blowback operation influenced some pistol designs like the [[Makarov PM]].
Available in different variants and [[handgun_cartridge|pistol cartridges]], the most prominent one is the shortened [b]Walther PPK[/b] ([i]Kurz[/i]) which is associated with [[James Bond]] franchise.

h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[PPK (Girls' Frontline)]]

title: hibiki_ryouga
body:
Important character from [[Ranma 1/2]].

He and [[Saotome Ranma]] are rivals. Ryouga is also an martial artist and turns into a small black pig ([[P-chan]]) whenever he gets wet with cold water. Loves [[Tendou Akane]].
Voiced by [[Yamadera Kouichi]].

title: tendou_nabiki
body:
Character from [[Ranma 1/2]].
She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]]. 
As the middle sister, she is shorter than [[Tendou Kasumi|Kasumi]] but taller than [[Tendou Akane|Akane]].
Voiced by [[Takayama Minami]].

title: monk_(age_of_empires_ii)
body:
A unit in the [[Age of Empires II]] strategy game, succeeding the [[Priest (aoe)|]] of the [[age of empires (series)|first game]]. Like its predecessor, the monk has the ability to heal friendly units and convert enemies, while also having the exclusive ability of picking up relics.

The monk is a bald man with white robes and a [[tabard]] of their team's color. They hold a large book in one hand and a [[shepherd's crook]] in the other.

title: male_robin_(festive_tactician)_(fire_emblem)
body:
Tag used for [[Male robin (fire emblem)|Male Robin]] from [[Fire Emblem]] specifically when dressed in his winter attire from the [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] 2017 "Winter's Envoy":[https://feheroes.gamepedia.com/Winter's_Envoy_(Focus)] banner.

Can typically be identified thanks to the attire's characteristics: A red [[cloak]] with [[gold trim]] and a [[star]]-shaped pattern on the sleeves, a white [[tunic]] over a black [[undershirt]], red [[mittens]], black [[boots]], and a fake [[christmas tree]] with a [[candy cane]] for the log.

Note that it's possible (especially for older artwork), to depict Male Robin in a winter outfit without it being the one described above, in which case this tag should not be used.

title: female_robin_(seaside_tactician)_(fire_emblem)
body:
[[female robin (fire emblem)|Female Robin]] from [[Fire Emblem Awakening]] when dressed in her summer attire from [[Fire_Emblem_Heroes]]' 2017 "Ylissean Summer":[https://feheroes.fandom.com/wiki/Ylissean_Summer_(Focus)] banner. 

The Robin unit using this outfit is officially known as [i]Robin: Seaside Tactician[/i]

Can typically be identified thanks to the outfit's characteristics: a purple [[o-ring bikini]] with a large [[coat]] draped over it, a brown [[belt]], large brown [[boots]], a large [[net]] containing [[fish]], and a [[basket]] containing an [[octopus]].

Likely to include her weapon from the game, a large [[harpoon]] with a [[fish]] skewered on its points.

Note that it's possible (especially in older artwork) to depict Female Robin in a swimsuit without it being the one described above, in which case this tag should not be used.

title: female_robin_(fell_tactician)_(fire_emblem)
body:
Alternative design for [[Female robin (fire emblem)|Robin]] (more specifically [[Grima_(fire_emblem)|]]) from [[Fire Emblem Awakening]]; the outfit was originally designed for a card art in [[Fire Emblem Cipher]]. It was slightly modified when it was reused in [[Fire Emblem Heroes]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24620435: [[Fire Emblem Cipher]]
* !post #5753099: [[Fire Emblem Heroes]]

title: female_robin_(halloween)_(fire_emblem)
body:
[[Female robin (fire emblem)|Female Robin]] from [[Fire Emblem]] specifically when dressed in her Halloween/"Harvest Festival" attire from the [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] 2020 "Dragons Harvest":[https://feheroes.fandom.com/wiki/Dragons_Harvest_(Focus)] banner.

In-game, it's clear that Female Robin is being possessed by [[Grima (Fire Emblem)|]] (as indicated by her having [[red eyes]] and [[purple fire]] floating around). If either of these elements are present in the image, Grima should also be tagged.

Note that it's possible (especially for older artwork) to depict Female Robin in a Halloween outfit without it being the one described above, in which case this tag should not be used.

title: female_robin_(valentine)_(fire_emblem)
body:
Tag used for [[Female robin (fire emblem)|]] in her attire in the 2022 "Here With Me":https://feheroes.fandom.com/wiki/Here_with_Me_(Focus) [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] banner.

It is possible that she may be drawn in a valentine context before the appearance of the banner or with a different outfit, in which case the tag should not be used.

TBU

title: fire_emblem_engage
body:
The 17th installment in the [[Fire Emblem]] series for the [[Nintendo Switch]], released January 20, 2023.

Art designs by [[Mika Pikazo]].

The story revolves around the Divine Dragon [[Alear (Fire Emblem)|]], with the ability to summon characters from the previous titles.

title: robin_(fire_emblem)
body:
A customizable character in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]]. Can be [[male robin (fire emblem)|male]] or [[female robin (fire emblem)|female]]. Default gender is male and default name (which is also the name given to the character in [[Super Smash Bros.]] for 3DS/Wii U) is [b]Robin[/b] ([b]Rufure[/b]/[b]Reflet[/b] in the Japanese version). Has little memory of the past, but is a gifted tactician.

Also known in the English versions as an [b]Avatar[/b].

h4. Appearance

* !post #2716653: [[male robin (fire emblem)|Male]]
* !post #2716656: [[female robin (fire emblem)|Female]]

title: chikan
body:
A person [[groping]] another without permission in a crowd, a rush-hour train, etc.

h4.See also

* [[chijo]]
* [[molestation]]

h4.External links
* "Wikipedia: Chikan":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chikan_(body_contact)]

title: molestation
body:
Unwanted [[groping]] or being touched sexually by another. Tends to occur in  and in [[public indecency]].

Use [[chikan]] if the act is happening in a [[crowd]].

h4. Related tags

* [[compensated molestation]]
* [[sleep molestation]]

h4. See also

* [[forced]]
* [[rape]]

title: male_alear_(engaging_fire)_(fire_emblem)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Male alear (fire emblem)|Male Alear]] in [[Fire Emblem Heroes]].

title: female_alear_(awoken_divinity)_(fire_emblem)
body:
An [[official_alternate_costume|alternate costume]] of [[female alear (fire emblem)|female Alear]], used for her advanced class form of divine dragon in [[fire_emblem_engage|Fire Emblem Engage]] and as a base outfit in [[fire_emblem_heroes|Fire Emblem Heroes]].

Using the default outfit as a base, it adds some modifications, such as replacing her silver [[crown_braid|crown braid]] with a [[gold|golden]] one, [[arm_armor|armouring up the sleeves]] and adding a [[armored_skirt|partially armoured skirt]] on the left and right sides and lastly decorating her [[upper_body|upper torso]] area a bit and adding a few [[gold_trim|gold trims]] to the [[miniskirt|miniskirt]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6641047

title: alear_(fire_emblem)
body:
Main character and the Divine Dragon of [[Fire Emblem Engage]].

They have [[male alear (fire emblem)|male]] and [[female alear (fire emblem)|female]] versions.

Outstanding features include their [[multicolored hair|multicolored]] [[blue hair| blue]] and [[red hair|red]] hair along with [[blue eyes|blue]] and [[red eyes|red]] [[heterochromia|heterochromic]] eyes.

title: shimono_hiro
body:
(しもの ひろ)

[[voice actor|Voice actor]].

h4.Characters voiced

* [[Agatsuma Zenitsu]] ([[Kimetsu no Yaiba]])
* [[Male alear (fire emblem)|Alear]] ([[Fire Emblem Engage]])

title: aegyo_sal
body:
A term used in Korea referring to the small, [b]puffy[/b] fatty deposits underneath the eyes that are said to give a person a more youthful appearance.

Commonly seen in artwork from non-Japanese East Asian countries, such as Korea and China. Certain fashion styles also often use lower eye makeup that accentuates this area, such as [[gyaru]] and [[jirai kei]].

In contrast, most Western cultures see these raised discs of flesh under the eyes mostly in elderly people and associate them with poorly-aging seniors, makeup being geared to make eyes look more deep-set and the skin around them smoother.

Do not confuse with [[bags under eyes]].

title: apocrypha/inheritance_of_glory
body:
[b]Apocrypha/Inheritance of Glory[/b]
[quote]A voice heard in a dream.

"Fated one who carves out their own destiny...answer my call."

The voice goes on. Another world is in crisis, and needs help if it is to be saved.
Following the mysterious voice, you participate in a strange reproduction of a Holy Grail War that has broken out in a land devoid of human reason.[/quote]

A collaboration event in [[Fate/Grand Order]] with [[Fate/Apocrypha]], released on the Japanese server on April 29, 2018 and on the NA server on April 24, 2020. [[Sieg (fate)|]] is given as a reward to players for completing the event.

title: tachibana_kanade
body:
A character from [[Angel Beats!]], primarily known as Angel/Tenshi. Voiced by [[Hanazawa Kana]]. 

She is the acting Student Council president and antagonist to the Shinda Sekai Sensen (Afterlife War Front).  She is capable of performing various supernatural abilities called "Guard Skills", such as summoning out of thin air blades from her forearms.  She is sometimes depicted with [[white wings]], while her main physical attributes are [[long hair|long]] [[light blue hair|light blue]] or [[aqua hair]] and [[yellow eyes]].

title: mapo_tofu
body:
A spicy Szechuan (Sichuan) dish with [[tofu]] in a red chili and bean sauce.

The original Chinese [i]mapo doufu[/i] is characterized by its "mala sauce":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mala_sauce]. The Japanese version, popularized by the Japanese chef "Chen Kenmin":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chen_Kenmin], lacks "Sichuan pepper":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sichuan_pepper] flavor.

Brought to light by [[Kotomine Kirei]]'s "Extra Spicy Mapo Tofu" featured in [[Fate/Stay Night]] and later featured as [[Craft Essence (fate)|]] in [[Fate/Grand Order]], as well as a seemingly inconsequential reference in episode 5 of [[Angel Beats!]] involving [[Tachibana Kanade]]. 

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Food tags]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Mapo Tofu":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mapo_tofu

title: frozen_(disney)
body:
An American animated musical fantasy film produced by [[Disney|Walt Disney Animation Studios]] and originally released in 2013. Its plot follows a young girl named [[Anna (Frozen)|]] who, accompanied by an iceman named [[Kristoff (Frozen)|]] and an anthropormorphic snowman named [[Olaf (Frozen)|]], attempts to find her estranged sister Elsa after she accidentally freezes the kingdom of Arendelle in an eternal winter with her ice powers. 

In 2019, the film was followed by a sequel, [i][[Frozen II (disney)|]][/i].

h4. Characters

It's a [[chef]] outfit consisting of a [[white hat|white]] [[tilted headwear|tilted]] [[mini hat|mini]]  [[mini_chef_hat|chef]] [[chef hat|hat]], a [[short dress|short]] [[white dress]] with [[three-quarter sleeves]], a [[red neckerchief]], [[wrist cuffs]] a [[double-breasted]] [[white apron]], [[white thighhighs]] and [[brown boots]]. Her hair is now tied into a [[short ponytail]] and decorated with a [[hairclip]].

title: sukue!_amazones.com
body:
[b]Save Amazones.com! ~CEO Crisis 2020~[/b]
[quote]All Servants, roll out!
Amazones.com, the largest shopping service in the Universe, has seen all of its employees mysteriously vanish overnight...
How could this happen to the company with the very best benefits package?
Amazones.com's CEO now faces the prospect of imminent bankruptcy.
To save Amazones.com, Chaldea has formed a temp agency to aid the company's delivery service!
The renewed Pagoda event is now open![/quote]

A limited time event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on January 22, 2020 and on the NA server on January 18, 2022.

title: saber_wars_ii
body:
[b]Shining Blue Galactic Space Opera: Saber Wars 4.8[br]SABER WARS 2 ~To the Beginning of Space~[/b]
[quote]This story has absolutely nothing to do with the main story...
In fact, it may have happened, and it may not have.
It is much like a certain blockbuster film franchise we all know so well.

In an unexpected turn of events, you have been taken to space. You panic at first, but your usual conviction that things will work out eventually kicks in, and you just hurl yourself into the final frontier. The Shining Blue Galaxy, also known as the Servant Universe, awaits you, brimming with both chaos and the myriad desires of its people.
Get your space suit on and embark on an unprecedented adventure![/quote]

A limited time event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on October 30, 2019 and on the NA server on October 18, 2021.

title: command_&_conquer
body:
[b]Command & Conquer[/b] (C&C) is a series primarily of real time strategy PC [[video game]]s that began with the eponymous first title in 1995.  First created by Westwood Studios, and later by [[Electronic Arts]] after they acquired Westwood and later dissolved Westwood Studios in 2003.  

Many former Westwood staff founded the studio Petroglyph Games, which was tapped by EA to develop a remaster of the original C&C games that was released in 2020.  Along with Westwood's previous RTS game Dune 2 (based on the sci-fi series [[Dune (series)|]]), the early C&C games helped codified the RTS genre.  The games were well know for their large tanks, live action cutscenes, mostly solid (albeit cheesy) story in the earlier installments, and great music.

The three C&C sub series:

* [i]Tiberium[/i] series (C&C Tiberian Dawn, [[Command and Conquer: Tiberian Sun]], [[Command and Conquer: Tiberium Wars]], C&C4 Tiberium Twilight): A toxic green alien space substance crashes on Earth.  Initially a boon by leeching out important minerals from the ground, making mining and energy easier to come by, it starts replicating out of control and mutating the landscape. Two initial factions, the UN agency the [[Global Defense Initiative]] and the mysterious cult the [[Brotherhood of Nod]], end up fighting over control of the world.

* [i]Red Alert[/i] series ([[Command and Conquer: Red Alert]], [[command & conquer: red alert 2|RA2]], [[command & conquer: red alert 3|RA3]]):  After World War II, [[Albert Einstein]] creates a time machine and goes back in time to erase [[Adolf Hitler]] from the timeline.  This ends up causing a timeline with a stronger Soviet Union that invades Europe.  The two initial factions were the Allies and the Soviet Union.  They're later joined by the third faction, The Empire of the Rising Sun.  The series generally has a much campier tone and comic book style plot.  Time travel plays a role throughout the various games.

* [i][[command & conquer: generals|Generals]][/i] series: the War of Terror in RTS format! The only series completely made by EALA and lacking live action cutscenes (except Generals Zero Hour).  The series featured three factions: United States, China, and the terrorist group, the Global Liberation Army.

In 2025, the Source codes for Generals (and Zero Hour), Red Alert 3, and Tiberium Wars were released, making their engines test to a new generation of future modifications. There won't be source codes for Red Alert 2 and Tiberian Sun at the moment.

title: battle_in_new_york_2019
body:
[b]Battle in New York 2019[/b]
[quote]To earn the honor of being known as the strongest Servant, the Heroic Spirits once again assemble in the golden city of New York! This annual contest of strength has become a traditional festival among Chaldea's Servants.
The audience screams for their champions as the endless deathmatches rage and both friendships and rivalries are formed!

And just as the grand contest that has been witness to so many legendary bouts nears its end, the fevered excitement of the festival reaches the very stars!

"Okay now. So is it finally my turn to shine?"

As the goddess's cry echoes across the skies, a close encounter of the third kind brings "Battle in New York 2019" into a whole new realm![/quote]
[expand=Original Description]
[quote]To earn the honor of being known as the strongest Servant, the Heroic Spirits once again assemble in the golden city of New York!
Who will rise to the top in this tournament, where only the mightiest reign supreme?

The magnificent festival of martial arts, where ranks and titles mean nothing, and all is ruled by the clash of raw strength!
"Battle in New York 2019" begins now![/quote]
[/expand]

A limited time event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on September 18, 2019 and on the NA server on September 2, 2021.

title: rise_of_the_reds
body:
A modification of the Command & Conquer: Generals Zero Hour mod. Includes 2 new factions that were going to be originally in the game but was cut due to publishing reasons.

The modifications include 2 new factions: Europe (ECA) and Russia (Russian Federation) as well as modifying the latter 3 Factions: USA China and GLA with more sophisticated units.


As of 2025, the mod is in production works and will be posting new articles in weeks. (1.9)

title: lady_reines_case_files
body:
[b]Phantasmal Collection Realm: Patchwork London[br]Lady Reines Case Files[/b]
[quote]The train stops in London's past. Standing at the center of the city is the Clock Tower, an ivory tower built by the obsessive, where mages proudly call their institution the essence of knowledge. It is a city brimming with magecraft and Mystics, where conspiracy and conflict cycle endlessly in pursuit of the Root.

And in this world of mages, at a simple flat, an encounter with a living Lord and a dead Lord... The smell of blood in the air signals the beginning of a new mystery, a new case.

"Hm? Of course you're going to cooperate. Don't tell me you're going to abandon a frail, defenseless young lady, are you?"[/quote]

A collaboration event in [[Fate/Grand Order]] with [[Lord El-Melloi II Case Files]], released on the Japanese server on April 27, 2019 and on the NA server on April 30, 2021. [[Gray (fate)|]] is given as a reward to players for completing the event.

title: jousting
body:
A [[medieval]] combat sport involving two participants riding a [[horse]] and [[charging forward]] into their opponents using a wooden [[lance]]. The one who managed to knock their opponent out of their steed is declared the winner. It is a common pastime activity among [[knight]]s and nobility during this period.

Note that this tag is also applicable to an actual [[duel]] where two participants are charging towards each other with their [[polearm]]s.

title: ooku_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Tokugawa Restoration Labyrinth: Ooku[/b]
[quote]Headquarters has fallen eerily silent, now almost empty following an attack from the outside. Master is called urgently to the Control Room, and along with the single Servant who managed to escape harm, Rayshifts to determine the cause.

They arrive in mid-seventeenth century Japan—the Edo period.
In the deepest reaches of Edo Castle, the epicenter of the issue, the silent abnormality still grows. The castle's Ooku, a realm detached from the rest of the world, has transformed into a bottomless labyrinth brimming with sinister mystery.
The party roams the endless paths of the luxurious osuzurouka, the "corridor of bells," in search of an exit.[/quote]

An event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on March 27, 2019 and on the NA server on March 23, 2021.

A singularity that formed on the bleached earth set in 17th century Japan during the [[Edo Jidai]]. It takes place before [[Yugakshetra (fate/grand order)|]] as a result of [[Arjuna Alter (fate)|]] absorbing the rest of the Indian pantheon and was created by [[Kama (Beast III/L) (fate)|Beast III/L]].

title: furuki_kumo_wa_kaiko_to_tomo_ni_ito_wo_tsumugu
body:
[b]An Old Spider Spins Webs of Memory[/b]
[quote]At least once in their lifetime, a person reflects back on all that might have been...

In the late 19th century, in a city somewhere in Europe, three groups struggle interminably for dominance. The delicate balance of their deadlock maintains peace in the city, but the arrival of three mages, all seeking a most precious treasure, threatens to upend everything...

This is the story of one whose regrets haunt him to this day. What careless mistake does he speak of? What plunged him into a world of remorse and self-recrimination?[/quote]

A limited time event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on March 11, 2019 and on the NA server on March 8, 2021.

title: voices_&_letters_collection!
body:
[b]Valentine's 2019: Voices & Letters Collection! ~Murasaki Shikibu and the Seven Cursed Books~[/b]
[quote]Chaldea's underground library has become a popular gathering spot among the Servants. The library, created by the magical energy of the current librarian, is home to various books from many times and places, and the Servants are drawn to the allure of this treasure trove of texts.

Our tale begins with a single book bathed in the magical energy that slumbers in the library. Why did this book emit a magical light and vanish, only to return as seven accursed books?[/quote]

A limited time [[Valentine]] event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on February 6, 2019 and on the NA server on February 3, 2021. This event introduced voice acting to the Valentine story scenarios.

title: suzume_no_oyado_no_katsudou_nisshi
body:
[b]Miyama Onsen Grand Shrine and Restaurant: Enma-tei[br]Sparrow's Inn Daily Report ~Records of the Enma-tei's Prosperity~[/b]
[quote]While Master was enjoying the bustling festivities of the New Year, an emergency call comes from the Command Room. The briefing this time details an all but harmless Singularity that appeared quite suddenly at a mountain hot springs resort. As such, the suggestion was to Rayshift there for a bit of rest and relaxation. Accompanied by the Servants who were drawn out by rumors of a hot springs trip, Master eagerly Rayshifts!

...But for some reason, everyone finds themselves in a deep forest overrun by a band of mischievous monkeys. After they save a mysterious sparrow from the primates' attack, it invites them to a nearby hot springs inn as a demonstration of gratitude for their help.

The inn looks magnificent at first sight, but behind its grandiose exterior, something seems off...[/quote]

A limited time [[New Year]] event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on January 1, 2019 and on the NA server on January 1, 2021.

h4. Craft Essences
* !post #4470215: Sign of Smiling Face
* !post #9022594: New Year's Mystique
* !post #9022612: A Modest Pig
* !post #9022630: Goddesses of the Glittering Snow

h4. See Also
* [[List of Fate/Grand Order events]]
other_names: 雀のお宿の活動日誌〜閻魔亭繁盛記〜

title: holy_samba_night
body:
[b]Christmas 2018: Holy Samba Night ~The Snowy Ruins and the Girl Knight~[/b]
[quote]Tis the season of Santa once more in Chaldea. This year, the previous Santa has selected a certain goddess to inherit the power of Santa Claus.

"Leave it to me! I'm very good at this sort of thing, yes!"

And as she tackled her Santa duties in a surprisingly normal way, it seemed this year's Christmas was going to go off without a hitch... That is, until Chaldea detected a new Singularity in Mexico. Master and company head there to investigate, and find themselves in a snow-covered city filled with the sounds of winter rejoicing.

"I had my suspicions, but..."
"This isn't Santa! This is samba!"

A new kind of miracle descends upon the city hwere masked fighters assembl! The starting bell of this thrilling carnival of the holy night rings...now![/quote]

A limited time [[Christmas]] event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on December 12, 2018 and on the NA server on December 13, 2020. [[Quetzalcoatl (Samba/Santa) (fate)|]] is given as a reward to players for completing the event.

title: shinpi_no_kuni_no_oniland!!
body:
[b]Northern Amusement Park ONI♡LAND[br]The Land of Mystique, ONILAND!! ~The Great Oni and the Kamuy's Gold~[/b]
[quote]A new Halloween story is about to begin...

The yearly Halloween Rayshift takes you to...a snow-covered land?!
Glittering snowflakes dance in the air, stands stuffed with delicious foods line the streets, dazzling performances run night and day, and of course everyone is smiling!
This place is an eternal paradise brimming with hopes and dreams...an amusement park where oni and pumpkins intertwine.
The gates of "The Land of Mystique, ONILAND!! ~The Great Oni and the Kamuy's Gold~" are now open![/quote]

A limited time [[Halloween]] event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on October 24, 2018 and on the NA server on October 19, 2020. [[Shuten Douji (Halloween Caster) (fate)|]] is given as a reward to players for completing the event.

title: battle_in_new_york_2018
body:
[b]Battle in New York 2018[/b]
[quote]With incredible rewards and the title of strongest Servant at stake, the fall festival for Chaldea's courageous warriors returns once again! As Nero, brimming with enthusiasm, makes her way to the Colosseum, the cheers of delighted crowds of Roman citizens shall greet her!

...Or not. What she finds instead is treasure stolen from her own vaults by persons unknown, and the voice of the King of Heroes echoing across the land.

"I shall determine who the strongest Servant is!"

The glorious brawl, Battle in New York 2018, begins now, hosted this time by none other than Gilgamesh![/quote]

A limited time event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on September 19, 2018 and on the NA server on September 14, 2020.

title: clutch_purse
body: A women's wallet, also known as a clutch, is a type of [[handbag]] without a shoulder strap, instead designed to be carried in the hands, which resembles a larger [[wallet]].

title: servant_summer_festival!_2018
body:
[b]Eternal Tropical Summer Altar: Luluhawa[br]Servant Summer Festival! 2018[/b]
[quote]Chaldea has detected a Foreigner in the Hawaiian Islands.
To make matters even stranger, Servants have begun to disappear from Chaldea!
Concerned by the seriousness of the situation, Master is dispatched with several Servants as a protection detail.
There, a bizarre battle in the tropics erupts.

A summer festival of the Servants, by the Servants, for the Servants—the Servant Summer Festival—is about to begin![/quote]

A limited time [[Summer]] event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on August 9, 2018 and on the NA server on August 3, 2020. [[Jeanne d'Arc Alter (Swimsuit Berserker) (fate)|]] is given as a reward to players for completing the event.

title: han'ei_no_chocolate_gardens_of_valentine
body:
[b]Valentine's 2018 ~The Bountiful Chocolate Gardens of Valentine~[/b]
[quote]The battle has already begun...
For some, it began the moment they decided to convey their feelings through a gift of chocolate.
For some, it began the moment they decided to make the chocolates that will be the vessel of their wish.
For some, it began the moment they shed tears of frustration over ungiven chocolates last year.
They now lay the groundwork for victory in the once-a-year battle called "Valentine's Day."

And one girl prepares to step into the battlefield for the first time ...[/quote]

A limited time [[Valentine]] event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on January 31, 2018 and on the NA server on February 3, 2020.

title: matsukai_mao
body:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual Youtuber|VTuber]]. Character design by [[Mokyu]]. 

h4. Appearance
[tn]See post #3675694.[/tn]

She is presented in lore as a cat familiar. This manifests in her base attribute of [[fake animal ears|fake]] [[cat ears]] and a [[spiked collar]], alongside [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] in [[twintails]], [[purple eyes]], [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]], [[black shirt|black]] [[crop top]], [[white shorts]], [[white jacket]], [[thigh strap]]s, [[striped legwear]], and [[sneakers]].

title: luis_cammy
body:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual Youtuber|VTuber]]. Character designed by [[Hario 4]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[red eyes]].

Her default outfit consists of a [[black shirt]] [[clothing cutout|open to the front]], a studded [[black belt]], [[black pants]] with her right leg side cut to shorts-level, a single red [[thigh boots|thigh boot]] to her right, and a [[heart tattoo]] below her right eye. Her outfit can also be described as an open [[bodystocking]].

title: setsubun_shuen_emaki
body:
[b]The Tale of Setsubun: Oni Pagoda Festival[/b]
[quote]This story happens sometime...somewhere. A minute story is discovered in the remote countryside of Japan.
There, a mysterious tower has been raised in a place where no building should stand. The structure's height and shape are architecturally impossible, and its purpose and function are unclear.
What manner of secrets could this tower hold?

And as for the two horned beings who were seen Rayshifting around the time the minute Singularity was detected...
What could they be scheming?
[/quote]

A limited time [[Setsubun]]-themed event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on January 24, 2018 and on the NA server on January 27, 2020.

title: meikai_no_merry_christmas
body:
[b]Merry Christmas in the Underworld[/b]
[quote]Even though Christmas is just fast approaching, Chaldea has been struck by a scorching heat wave!
As the temperature climbs past 107°F, staff members collapse from the heat, and even the Servants have come down with a mysterious fever...

The sole Servant untouched by this odd affliction insists that the only one who can resolve the bizarre weather and illness is Master...
With only half a day left until destruction, will Chaldea survive to see another Christmas?[/quote]

A limited time [[Christmas]] event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on December 15, 2017 and on the NA server on December 16, 2019. [[Altera the Santa (fate)|]] is given as a reward to players for completing the event.

title: halloween_strike!
body:
[b]Ultra Skyscraper Castle: Csejte Pyramid Himeji Castle[br]Halloween Strike! Demonic Climb: Himeji Castle War[/b]
[quote]"Trick or torture! It's that time of year again.
I hope all my lonely little pumpkins are doing all right...
The parade route's planned! Treats for the village kiddies are prepared!
Now I just have to send this invitation to Chaldea!
My third special concert is about to—Huh? What's that? Huuuh?
Am I seeing things?! Hey! EEEEEEEEEEEEK!!!"

The voicemail message cuts off there.
Something is happening.
Something...terrifying...[/quote]

A limited time [[Halloween]] event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on October 25, 2017 and on the NA server on October 23, 2019. Players can choose between [[Mecha Eli-chan (fate)|]] and [[Mecha Eli-chan Mk.II (fate)|]] as a reward for completing the event.

title: pouch
body:
Broad term for various small containers usually made from leather, textiles, or plastic. Objects called pouches include:

* A small non-rigid [[bag]] usually with a [[drawstring]] for holding or carrying things.
* A small semi-rigid container closed with a [[zipper]].
* A [[pocket]]-like semi-rigid container with a flap that folds over the opening. Pouches of this type may be designed to be worn like a belt, in which case they are tagged [[belt pouch]].

h4.See also

* [[ammunition pouch]]
* [[fanny pack]]
* [[handbag]]
* [[kinchaku]]
* [[pencil case]]
* [[sporran]]
* [[wallet]]
* [[bokjumeoni]]
* [[thigh pouch]]

title: shi_jin_(fate)
body:
Accompanies [[Eliza The Nine-tattooed Dragon (fate)|]] as her draconic three-sectioned staff. He was a Servant summoned with [[Elizabeth Bathory (fate/extra)|Lancer Elizabeth Bathory]], but they were defeated in battle. Shi Jin decided to impart his Spirit Origin to Elizabeth, fusing them together into the Nine-Tattoo Dragon Eliza.

Shi Jin is one of the 108 Stars of Destiny from [i]Water Margin[/i], specifically the Minute Star (#23 of the 36 Heavenly Stars), known as "Nine-Tattoo Dragon" for the many dragon tattoos on his body. Elizabeth Bathory herself is affiliated with dragons due to her family using the fang of a dragon as its family crest, so those aspects are fused together into their Pretender version.

title: eliza_the_nine-tattooed_dragon_(fate)
body:
Pretender-class version of [[Elizabeth Bathory (fate)|]], introduced in the [[108-nin no Halloween Rebellion!|2022 Halloween event]]. Also known as [b]Nine-Tattoo Dragon Eliza[/b], due to her connection with "Shi Jin":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shi_Jin from the "Water Margin":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Water_Margin and how he has nine dragon tattoos on his body. [[Shi Jin (fate)|]] is personified as Eliza's three section staff.

body:
A Rider-class servant introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[108-nin no Halloween Rebellion!]] event. He is based on the character of the same name from the Investiture of the Gods.

When using his [[Noble Phantasm (fate)|]], his four sons [[Huang Tianhua (fate)|]], [[Huang Tianlu (fate)|]], [[Huang Tianjue (Fate)|]], and [[Huang Tianxiang (fate)|]] manifest to assist him in battle.

title: bangboo_(zenless_zone_zero)
body: Ehn-nah, ehn-noo ah-noo-nah... Companion units in [[Zenless Zone Zero]]. Typically appear as a [[doll]]-like robot with [[rabbit ears]], though many personalized variants of bangboo exist. Invented by [[Sunbringer (zenless zone zero)|]], they were originally created to assist New Eridu residents with evacuations during Hollow disasters. Due to technological advancements, they have achieved a level of artificial intelligence on par with humans and are an indispensable part of New Eridu's daily operation. h4. title: glitch_text
body:
Glitch text, is digital text that has been modified with numerous combining characters, Unicode symbols used to add diacritics above or below letters, to appear frightening or glitchy.

Named for a 2004 Internet creepypasta story that ascribes it to the influence of an eldritch deity, Zalgo text has become a significant component of many Internet memes, particularly in the "surreal meme" culture. The formatting of Zalgo text also allows it to be used to halt or impair certain computer functions, whether intentionally or not.


Create stunning AI-generated glitch text effects in seconds

https://glitchtextgenerator.app/

title: nineball=cirno
body:
A [[fusion]] of [[Cirno]] from [[Touhou]] and [[Nineball]] from [[Armored Core]] her name comes from the upgraded version of Nine-ball, [[nineball seraph|Nine-ball=Seraph]]. She is universally depicted as Cirno with Nine-ball's red and black color scheme, and usually the back thrusters of either version of Nine-ball. She is sometimes drawn wielding Nine-ball's weapons and wearing a helmet modeled after Nine-ball's head.

Nineball=Cirno is a result of the similarities between Cirno and Nine-ball: Cirno is the (self-proclaimed) strongest, Nine-ball held the status of strongest, and they both have a connection to the number 9.

She may be known by some for the [[M.U.G.E.N]] character based off the idea.

title: henshin
body:
[b]Henshin[/b] (変身, lit. "transformation") is the term for the [[transformation]] sequences commonly seen in [[tokusatsu]], [[mecha]], and [[magical girl]] anime where a character transforms from their ordinary form into a more powerful form. The term is derived from Kafka's [[The Metamorphosis]].

Although some speculate that the "[[Henshin pose]]" originates from kabuki or cheerleading, the original inspiration is unclear.

h4. See also

* [[henshin pose]]
* [[transformation]]

h4. External links

* "TVTropes: Transformation Sequence":https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TransformationSequence

title: the_metamorphosis
body:
[b]The Metamorphosis[/b], also known simply as [b]Metamorphosis[/b] (German: [b]Die Verwandlung[/b]) is a [[fantasy]] novella written by "Franz Kafka":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franz_Kafka which was first published in 1915. 

One of Kafka's best-known works, Metamorphosis tells the story of young deserting and unemployed salesman [[Gregor Samsa]], who due to lack of money lives with his parents and wakes one morning to find himself inexplicably transformed into a huge insect (German: [i]ungeheueres Ungeziefer[/i], lit. "monstrous vermin") and subsequently struggles to adjust to this new condition. 

The novella has been widely discussed among literary critics, with differing interpretations being offered. In popular culture and adaptations of the novella, the insect is commonly depicted as a [[cockroach]]. The Japanese translation's title would inspire the coining of [[henshin]] in [[tokusatsu]] contexts.
other_names: 変身(フランツ・カフカ)

title: foil
body: A thin sheet of metal used to contain or cover food as wrappings or a tray,  traditionally [[gold]], aluminum, or tin. Not to be confused with [[foil (fencing)]].

title: zordon
body:
One of the original characters created for [[Power Rangers]], appearing from [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]] to [[Power Rangers in Space]] as an active character. The span of shows where he acted as a significant plot-related character (whether as a mentor per Mighty Morphin Power and Alien Rangers, or not) would result in this part of the Saban Era becoming known as the Zordon Age.

His name would be recycled from a similar sounding name from the Americanized [[Choudenshi Bioman]] pilot, which referred to the main antagonist, Doctor Man, as Zadar, with the Mighty Morphin pilot turning it into Zoltar, before finally becoming Zordon (along with the mechas going from Droids to Zords, derived from the word 'sword', per [[Dino Megazord]]'s sword). Elements of [[Choujin Sentai Jetman]], which received a pilot pitch after, would later be reused for Mighty Morphin under Zordon.
other_names: ゾードン(パワーレンジャー)

body:

title: choudenshi_bioman
body:
The 8th [[Super Sentai]] series.

After [[Marvel]]'s attempt with [[Taiyou Sentai Sun Vulcan]], Haim Saban would make his first attempt at pitching an American Sentai adaptation with "Bioman":[https://lostmediawiki.com/Bio-Man_(partially_found_unaired_pilot_of_Haim_Saban_adaptation_of_%22Choudenshi_Bioman%22_Super_Sentai_TV_series;_1986)]. Elements of Bioman would be carried over into the eventual adaptation in [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]], such as [[Peebo]] inspiring [[Alpha 5]] and the earliest instance of [[Zordon]]'s name. He would try again with [[Kyouryuu Sentai Zyuranger]], which would be successfully adapted.

A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] who debuted in the first wave of Nijisanji SEEDs, and was integrated into the main Nijisanji group in December 2018. Designed by [[Hoojiro]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[light brown hair]] (can also be [[blonde hair|blonde]]) with [[parted bangs|parted]] [[choppy bangs]] and [[brown eyes]].

title: ryuushen
body:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]], real name Sengawa Midori. They debuted in the first wave of Nijisanji SEEDs, before later being integrated into the main Nijisanji group in December 2018. Designed by [[Asasumiboochan]].

They have [[purple eyes]] and [[green hair]] with an [[ahoge]]. They are officially of unknown gender and typically appear [[androgynous]].

title: nakao_azuma
body:
A former [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]]. Designed by [[Sacanahen]].

She debuted in the first wave of Nijisanji SEEDs. Later she would be integrated into the main Nijisanji group in December 2018.

An active girl who preferred to move rather than sit still. She liked pretty things, but felt that they don't suit her. She basically chose and wore only boyish clothes.

She retired on March 31, 2019.

title: dola_(nijisanji)
body:
A [[Nijisanji|]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]]. Designed by [[G.T]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]], [[red eyes]], [[dragon horns]], [[dragon tail|tail]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default look is arguably one of the most revealing in Nijisanji, wearing only a [[black choker]] and [[thigh strap]] while accounting for the dark dragon skin color conveniently acting as a dress of sorts.

title: azuchi_momo
body:
A former [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual YouTuber]], part of Nijisanji SEEDs first batch. Originally designed by [[Moeki Yuuta]], subsequently redesigned by [[Yuuki (irodo rhythm)|]]. Graduated on January 31, 2024. 

h4. Appearance

[tn]See post #3642479.[/tn]

title: mamehinata
body:
[[Mamehinata]] is an original 3D character created by [[Mochiyama Kingyo]] in [[VRChat]].

She is a [[dog girl]] with [[brown hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her hair features an [[ahoge]] and a [[hairpin]], and she wears a [[visor cap]].

Her upper body attire includes a large [[belt collar]] and a [[short over long sleeves]] [[shirt]], with an outer [[red shirt]] and an inner [[white shirt]]. Her lower attire is a pair of [[black shorts]].

Her legs are covered in [[loose socks]] and she wears [[blue shoes]]. Mamehinata also has a small backpack on her back, which is not usually visible, with only the shoulder strap visible on the front.

title: oliver_evans
body:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual YouTuber|]], part of the group [[Eden-gumi]] and designed by [[Natsuko (Bluecandy)|]]. 

He is portrayed with [[brown hair]] [[hair over one eye|covering his right eye]], and [[green eyes]] [[mole under eye|with a mole under his left eye]].

h4. Costumes

* !post #4648814: [[Oliver Evans (1st costume)|Default]]
* !post #6436172: [[Oliver Evans (2nd costume)|2nd costume]]: Casual
* !post #7996105: [[Oliver Evans (3rd costume)|3rd costume]]: Formal
* !post #7199350: [[Oliver Evans (4th costume)|4th costume]]: New Year

h4. Nijisanji units and groups

h5. [[Eden-gumi]] (debut group)
* [[Axia Krone]] (graduated)
* [[Lain Paterson]]
* [[Lauren Iroas]]
* [[Leos Vincent]]
* [b]Oliver Evans[/b]

h4. External links

* "YouTube channel":[https://www.youtube.com/@OliverEvans]
* "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/oliverD_23]

title: lauren_iroas
body:

title: lain_paterson
body:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]], part of the group [[Eden-gumi]]. designed by [[Lack]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] with [[black hair|black]] [[streaked hair|streaks to the front]], tied into a [[ponytail]] and [[hair over one eye|covering her left eye]], [[grey eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

She has a living shark-shaped ammunition pouch named [[hohojiro-san (lain paterson)|Hohojiro-san]].

h4. Costumes

h5. Official costumes with a model

* !post #4648803: [[Lain Paterson (1st costume)|Default]]
* !post #7366480: [[Lain Paterson (2nd costume)|2nd costume]]: Maid/Bunny suit
* !post #7366478: [[Lain Paterson (3rd costume)|3rd costume]]: Idol theme
* !post #7366477: [[Lain Paterson (4th costume)|4th costume]]: Knitted Dress
* !post #7048678: [[Lain Paterson (5th costume)|5th costume]]: New Year
* !post #7854922: [[Lain Paterson (6th costume)|6th costume]]: China Dress

h5. Costumes shared with other members

* !post #6933535: [[Nijisanji Fes t-shirt|NijiFes]]: Group Violet

title: axia_krone
body:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual YouTuber]] "graduate":[https://twitter.com/AXIA_96NE/status/1598165014527234051]. Designed by [[Kurono Yuu]].

Presented in-lore as a pilot of the mobile infantry "Thrones", Axia announced his graduation on November 30, 2022 after an extended hiatus.

He has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. 

h4. Costumes

* !post #4657201: [[Axia Krone (1st costume)|1st costume]]
* !asset #22532201: [[Axia Krone (2nd costume)|2nd costume]]
* !post #6403494: [[Axia Krone (3rd costume)|3rd costume]]

h4. Nijisanji units and groups

h5. [[Eden-gumi]] (debut group)
* [b]Axia Krone[/b] (graduated)
* [[Lain Paterson]]
* [[Lauren Iroas]]
* [[Leos Vincent]]
* [[Oliver Evans]]

h4. External links

title: bake-danuki_(ichiren_takushou)
body: An [[original]] character by [[ichiren takushou]]. She is a bake-danuki who was taken home by a human man and became his wife. She has [[black hair]], [[raccoon ears]], and a [[raccoon tail]].

title: iyo_(fate)
body:
Originally mentioned in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s 2020 [[GUDAGUDA Yamatai-koku]] event, then introduced as a welfare Ruler-class Servant during the [[GUDAGUDA Shin Yamatai-koku]] event. Iyo is [[Himiko (fate)|]]'s disciple and successor to the nation of Yamatai-koku.

title: kuzuha_(nijisanji)
body:
A [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] who originally started as an [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] before joining [[Nijisanji]] through [[Nijisanji Gamers]], before that whole branch was absorbed into Nijisanji proper. Designed by [[Loalo]].

He has [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] and [[red eyes]]. Because he's a [[vampire]], he has [[pointy ears]] and [[fangs]]. There's a [[mole under eye|mole]] located under his right eye.

title: yamiyono_moruru
body:
A fomer [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] affiliated with [[Nijisanji]], and was a member of [[Nijisanji Gamers]].

A soft spoken [[demon girl]] with a very laid back personality. She normally has a Gothic or punkish appearance, wearing a [[torn shirt]] over a [[black dress]] with [[two-tone hair]] (black and pink) and [[bags under eyes|bags under her eyes]]. 

For reasons unknown, Moruru suddenly announced her retirement["link":[https://twitter.com/_rnrrdark/status/1143068617098981381]] on June 24, 2019. Her last stream would be a few days later on June 27, and a short while after all videos on her channel were made private or otherwise removed.

title: yamanami_keisuke_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]]’s depiction of Yamanami Keisuke, the general-secretary of the [[Shinsengumi]]. He was part of the assassination of [[Serizawa Kamo (fate)|]] and became the organization's second-in-command after Kondou Isami took over until he deserted for unclear reason and committed [[seppuku]] once he was detained, after which [[Hijikata Toshizou (fate)|]] replaced him. 

Originally introduced as an NPC in the [[GUDAGUDA Yamatai-koku]] event, then became summonable as a Saber-class Servant in the [[GUDAGUDA Shin Yamatai-koku]] event.

title: komahime_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant introduced in the [[GUDAGUDA Shin Yamatai-koku]] event. Komahime was a princess of the Warring States period and the daughter of Mogami Yoshiaki, [i]daimyō[/i] of Dewa. Though she was slated to marry [[Toyotomi Hideyoshi (fate)|]]'s illegitimate child Hideyori, after a proper heir was born in Hidetsugu, Hideyori was sentenced to death and Komahime was executed along with him. Her tragic end at the age of fourteen inspired her father to side against Hideyoshi.

[spoilers]She is the other half of the Servant [[Sen no Rikyu (fate)|]], with her forming the basis of Rikyu's current appearance. The two bonded over their mutual hatred of the Toyotomi clan and, along with the spirits of countless others who shared their grudge, merged together into one Servant. While her personality lies dormant in Rikyu's First and Second Ascensions, she takes over in their Third Ascension.[/spoilers]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Albino (a1b1n0623)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Sonozaki Mie]]

title: katz_kobayashi
body:
A fictional [[child|underage]] character from [[Gundam]]. He first appeared in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979.

He also appears in [[Zeta Gundam]] (1985) as a youngster. [b]Katz Kobayashi[/b] becomes a member of the crew of the [[AEUG]] battleship, The [[Argama]], and fights as a [[nemo_(mobile_suit)|Nemo]] [[mobile suit]] and a [[Core Fighter]]/[[G-Defenser]] combat [[pilot]] against the oppressive [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]]. [spoiler]Sadly, he dies during the final battle of The Gryps War at the end of the series, killed by [[Yazan Gable]] in his [[Hambrabi]].[/spoiler]

h4. See also
* [[Sarah Zabiarov]]

title: sen_no_rikyu_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant who was introduced in the [[GUDAGUDA Shin Yamatai-koku]] event. Sen no Rikyu is known as a progenitor of [i]chanoyu[/i], or "The Way of Tea", in particular of [i]wabi-cha[/i] which emphasizes simplicity. For some reason, Rikyu appears as a petite female even though [[Oda Nobunaga (fate)|]] has always known him as a towering old man. Her third ascension is locked until players complete a Saint Graph unlock quest.

[spoilers]In actuality, she is an amalgamation of the grudge of people killed unfairly by [[Toyotomi Hideyoshi (fate)|]]; which includes Sen no Rikyu himself [i]and[/i] a girl named [b][[Komahime (fate)|]][/b], whose collective appearance this Servant is based on.[/spoilers]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Albino (a1b1n0623)|]]

title: dirndl
body:
A dirndl is a type of traditional [[dress]] worn in Bavaria, Liechtenstein, Austria and South Tyrol, based on the historical costume of Alpine peasants. An iconic outfit for female [[beer]] [[waitress|servers]] during [[Oktoberfest]].

A dirndl consists of a [[bodice]] and [[skirt]] or a [[pinafore dress]], a low-cut [[blouse]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], and a [[waist apron]].

The position of the [[apron]] [[bow]] can indicate a woman's marital status:

* Bow on left: [b]Single[/b]
* Bow on right: [b]Married[/b]
* Bow in middle: [b]Virgin[/b]
* Bow in back: [b]Widow[/b] [i](or waitress)[/i]

h4. See also

* [[German clothes]]
* [[Lederhosen]]
* [[Oktoberfest]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dirndl":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dirndl

title: prototype_stark_jegan
body:
A fictional giant manned military robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]RGM-89S Prototype Stark Jegan[/b]

An [[Earth Federation]] early proposal for the [[Stark Jegan]] developed by [[Anaheim Electronics]]. Armed with massive anti-ship missiles, the Prototype Stark Jegan had a two-seater elongated cockpit and two Machine Cannons in its redesigned chest. 

While this long-range assault variant eventually was passed on in favor of the more well-rounded definitive Stark Jegan, it had combat prowess, and saw action as part of the [[Nahel Argama]]'s "Band of Misfit Mobile Suits" squad.

title: rindr_(fate)
body:
One of the [[Valkyrie (fate)|]] Servants. She has very short blonde hair done up in a braided bun, and yellow head wings.

She was originally seen as part of the primary Valkyrie Lancer's Noble Phantasm. She is eventually given a name in the summer 2022 event, and functions as an alternate costume for [[thrud (swimsuit assassin) (fate)|Thrud Swimsuit Assassin]], also given her own voice lines.

title: valkyrie_(fate)
body:
Umbrella tag for the three Lancer-class Servants in [[Fate/Grand Order]] who use [i]Valkyrie[/i] as their collective title. Three are featured in the original servant's release, while three more were released in the [[Arctic Summer World!]] event. All of the Valkyries have [[red eyes]] and the [[look-alike|same face]], while their hairstyles and hair colors differ. They all consider themselves [[sisters]] as divine spirits created by Odin.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]

body:
A mass-produced [[mobile suit]] in [[gundam gquuuuuux|Mobile Suit Gundam GQuuuuuuX]].

[b]gMS-01 Gelgoog[/b]

As an alternate timeline counterpart to [[Gelgoog]] and a mass-produced model of [[White Gundam]], this [[mobile suit]] resembles a heavily modified [[gm (mobile suit)|GM]] ([[GM II]]) from the original timeline instead of the [[Zaku]].

[spoilers]One red and white unit was piloted by [[Shiiko Sugai]].[/spoilers]

title: pipo_monkey
body:
Monkeys in the [[Saru Getchu|Ape Escape]] series. They are under control of [[Specter (saru getchu)|]].

They have a big mouth and eyes with [[solid circle pupils]], wear [[shorts]] of different colors (mostly [[yellow shorts|yellow]]), and a mind control helmet called the Pipo Helmet. The Pipo Helmet alerts of the monkeys behavior with a siren light on top of it; where Blue means the monkey is relaxed, Yellow meaning it's alert, and Red meaning it's aggressive.

h4. See also

* [[Pipo Snake]]

title: wu_zetian_(fate)
body:
Assassin-class Servant first seen in the [[Agartha (fate/grand order)|]] chapter of [[Fate/Grand Order]] as the [b]Assassin of Nightless City[/b]. The concubine of Emperor Taizong, but after his death, she married his son Gaozong and became Empress following a debilitating stroke that Gaozong suffered. She implemented the short-lived Zhou Dynasty in 690, interrupting the Tang Dynasty until it was abolished in 705 after her death.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Harada Takehito]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Izawa Shiori]]

title: kawarajima_kou
body:
Pen name used by Japanese manga artist duo consisting of K・かわしま (K. Kawashima) and カラシマヒロユキ (Karashima Hiroyuki, aka. H. Karashima). Because they previously worked as assistants to [[Urushihara Satoshi]], their art style is very similar to his.

Japanese name: かわらじま 晃 or かわらじま コウ (Kawarajima Kou)
Circle name: 片励会 (Henreikai)

title: scathach_(fate)
body:
A Heroic Spirit in [[Fate/Grand Order]] also appearing in [[Fate/Extella Link]]. The Witch of Dun Scaith. She was the teacher of [[Cu Chulainn (fate/stay night)|]] from [[Fate/Stay Night]].

She has [[very long hair]] that is desaturated reddish magenta but often perceived to be [[purple hair|purple]], and [[red eyes]], and wears a purple [[bodysuit]]. Like [[Cu Chulainn (fate/stay night)|]], she wields the [[spear]] [[Gae Bolg (fate)|]], and dual-wields them for her Noble Phantasm, the [i]"Gae Bolg Alternative"[/i].

Scathach has a generally calm and somewhat serious personality. However, this does not prevent her from caring about sexual matters, at one point even asking her master to bear their child when they're stuck on an island during the 2016 summer event.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Koyama Hirokazu]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Noto Mamiko]]

title: scathach_skadi_(fate)
body:
Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]] during the [[Gotterdammerung (fate/grand order)|Norse Lostbelt]], and is the queen of said Lostbelt. She is the Caster-class version of [[Scathach (fate)|]]. Her name is stylized as [b]Scáthach Skaði[/b].

She is the goddess Skadi fused with Scathach by Odin to avoid [[Surtr (fate)|]]'s detection.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Koyama Hirokazu]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Noto Mamiko]]

title: ienaga_mugi
body:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual YouTuber]], pert of the JP second wave. Character designed by [[Takehana Note]]. 

She is a Hikikomori middle school third-year who has [[blonde hair]] and [[brown eyes]], wears pink [[striped shirt|striped]] [[pajamas]] and [[headphones]], and has some talent in music (guitar and keyboard) and English. She broadcasts from over a [[safe (container)|safe]] in her closet. 

She is grouped with Riri and with Tamaki (who she scuffles a bit with) from Wave Two.

title: ushimi_ichigo
body:
[b]Ushimi Ichigo[/b] is a [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual YouTuber]]. Character designed by [[Methyl Key]].

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[pink hair]] and [[pink eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[purple headwear|purple]] [[cabbie hat]], purple [[ascot]] and [[capelet]], [[puffy shorts]], and [[white thighhighs]]. 

She is presented in lore as an eight-year-old strawberry milk sea slug and made her debut on March 7th, 2018 with the rest of Nijisanji's second wave.

title: shibuya_hajime
body:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual Youtuber|VTuber]], part of the inaugural batch of eight. Designed by [[Hoojiro]]. 

He is portrayed as a young man with bright [[green hair]], [[blue eyes]], and is wearing [[glasses]]. 

His default attire consists of a black [[hood]]ed [[track jacket]], [[white shirt]] underneath, [[black pants]] with the left leg side [[pants rolled up|rolled up]], and [[slippers]]. One of the more technically minded members, he provided a lot of technical support to his peers. He was the only male presenting character of the original cast.

title: tsukino_mito
body:
A [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] from [[Nijisanji]], part of the inaugural batch of eight. Designed by [[Nezumidoshi]]. 

Her character is a 16-year-old, 2nd year high school student who is president of her class. As such, she often starts her videos with the phrase "Stand! Attention!" (きりーつ! 気をつけ!), and fans have responded by calling her "Chairman" (委員長 | iinchou). 

She often collaborates with her fellow classmates [[Higuchi Kaede]] (who shares the same illustrator) and [[Shizuka Rin]], under the name [[JK Gumi (Nijisanji)|JK-gumi]]. She reached one million subscribers on 12 December 2022, the fifth Nijisanji VTuber to reach this milestone.

She was one of Nijisanji's first eight VTubers revealed on Feb 7th, 2018. Since then, she has become the most prominent of the group and [i]de facto[/i] first character. Like the other Nijisanji personalities, her content focuses on livestreams and direct interaction with her audience.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and dark [[blue eyes]].

title: dokibird_(vtuber)
body:
An English-speaking [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] that started streaming in January 2017. She is a legendary thief per her lore, and commonly streamed herself doing art and playing games. Members of her fanbase are known as "[[dragoon (dokibird)|]]s." She has two stuffed rabbit plushies named [[Mei Mei (dokibird)|Mei Mei]] (black) and  [[Bao Bao (dokibird)|Bao Bao]] (white).

Her initial run ended with a graduation stream on May 14, 2021, but she later announced that she would start streaming again on February 8, 2024. During the hiatus she performed through [[Nijisanji]] as [[Selen Tatsuki]].

Due to the circumstances behind her controversial dismissal from Nijisanji in February 2024 and how public the entire situation became, Dokibird is much more open about her "past life" than most VTubers tend to be.

When streaming with [[Laimu (VTuber)|]], [[Mint Fantome]], and [[Snuffy (VTuber)|]], they are known as the "Sloppy Sisters."

title: resident_evil
body:
[b]Resident Evil[/b] (known in Japan as [b]Biohazard[/b] ([b]バイオハザード[/b]) is a media franchise consisting of a survival horror/[[Biopunk]] video games series, comic books, novelizations, six Hollywood motion pictures, and a variety of collectibles, including action figures, strategy guides and publications. Developed by [[Capcom]] and created by Shinji Mikami, the game series has been influenced by George A. Romero's [i]Dead[/i] movies.

title: dieselpunk
body:
Also called [b]Decopunk[/b], A genre of [[science fiction]] set typically between [[World War I]] or [[World War II]] and the start of the Cold War, with petroleum-based fuels starting to dominate transportation and industry. It tends to focus on a brutalist and often art deco aesthetic, and is seen as a continuation of the styles and themes explored in the [[steampunk]] genre.

h4. Notable Dieselpunk franchises

title: post-apocalypse
body:
The desolation left behind after a huge war or other major disaster on a global scale. The settings were often used in fictional works of varying genres. Usually involves the theme of "survival of the fittest", a fascination of the bygone civilizations, an attempt to restore the old worlds, as well as a "savior" who protects the weak from the oppressive tyrant.

title: death_note
body:
A supernatural/[[goth fashion|gothic]] thriller manga series written by Ooba Tsugumi and illustrated by [[Obata Takeshi]] and published on [[Weekly Shounen Jump]] on 2003. An anime adaption produced by [[Madhouse]] was aired from 2006 to 2007. There are also live-action adaptions, novels, and sequels.

[[Yagami Light]] is a brilliant young man who one day finds a black notebook called a [[Death Note (object)|]] which can kill anyone whose name is written in it. Light uses it to secretly kill criminals, drawing the attention of Interpol and the enigmatic detective [[L (death note)|]]. This ultimately leads him to a psychological game of cat-and-mouse as Light avoids the authorities while attempting to create a new world in his own vision.

title: blame!
body:
[i]Blame![/i], pronounced "blam", is a seinen manga [[cyberpunk]]/[[science fiction]]/[[goth fashion|gothic]] [[horror (theme)|Horror]] series by artist [[Nihei Tsutomu]], originally published in Kodansha's [b]Afternoon[/b].

The story follows [[Killy]], a silent loner wandering 'The City', an endless, ever-growing maze of random walls, stairs, and doorways, in search for Net Terminal Genes. These genes, thought to be extinct, would allow humans to access the Netsphere, the control system for The City and hopefully putting an end to the unceasing growth.

title: rainbow_(band)
body:
English Rock band formed in London in 1975, by [[Deep Purple]] Guitarist Ritchie Blackmore and [[Ronnie James Dio]].
its know for pioneering the [[heavy Metal]] genre thanks for the songs "Kill the King" and "Stargazer"

title: nevermind
body:
"Nevermind" is the second studio album by the American [[rock (music)|rock]] band [[nirvana (band)|Nirvana]], released in 1991. The album features a mix of heavy and melodic songs, with themes of social alienation, personal conflict, and self-doubt. "Nevermind" is widely regarded as one of the most influential albums of the 1990s and helped popularize the "grunge" genre. The album's lead single, "Smells Like Teen Spirit," became a massive hit and helped Nirvana achieve worldwide fame. It is famous for its [[album cover]], which features a naked baby boy, [[swimming]] [[underwater]] in a [[pool]] while following a US one [[dollar bill]] attached to a [[fish hook|fishing line]].

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Nirvana":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nirvana_(band)]
* "Wikipedia: Nevermind":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nevermind]
* "Album cover link":[http://www.solarnavigator.net/music/music_images/Nirvana_Nevermind_album_cover.jpg]

title: grotta
body: The eldest sister of the Stomach family featured in [[Kamen Rider Gavv]]. Like her siblings, she is a Granute and oversees the family company's production line. She wields a [[scythe]] and her true form resembles a [[squid]].
other_names: グロッタ・ストマック

title: ishtar_(fate)
body:
The Babylonian goddess of love and war, she is an Archer-class pseudo-Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] using [[Tohsaka Rin]]'s body as a container. Her [[weapon]] is [[Heavenly Boat Maanna]]. In [[Fate/Strange Fake]], [spoiler]she possesses the body of an Einzbern homunculus named [[Fillia (fate)|]].[/spoiler] 

Ishtar is considered a separate character from [[Tohsaka Rin]] for tagging purposes. Only tag both if both are present in the image.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Morii Shizuki]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Ueda Kana]]

title: peroponesosu.
body:
Artist.

Mainly draws [[Touhou]] characters with either exaggerated features (such as bigger clothes or hats) or doing strange things that correlate with the character themselves, be it their abilities, whatever they're wearing, ect.

body:
The 11th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Lize Helesta]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/Lize_Helesta/status/1919017831087169644], debuting in May 2025, inspired by an unofficial 2023 birthday illustration by [[Fuzichoco]].

A [[Qi Lolita]] costume in two color variants, white and black.

title: dina_ariya
body:
Female artist and animator, primarily drew Touhou

title: wendi_(nikke)
body:
A friendly mass-produced NIKKE and one of [[rapi_(nikke)|RR-15436's]] first friends. Together with their other friend [[rio_(nikke)|Rio]], they formed the Nikke squad Skull Head.

[spoilers]During a mission, she was forced to kill a corrupted Rio, and ends up killing herself afterward.[/spoilers]

title: rio_(nikke)
body:
A somewhat-surly mass-produced NIKKE and one of [[rapi_(nikke)|RR-15436's]] first friends. Together with their other friend [[wendi_(nikke)|Wendi]], they formed the Nikke squad Skull Head.

[spoilers]During a mission, she ends up becoming corrupted and is killed by Wendi.[/spoilers]

title: grimms_notes
body:
A mobile game from [[Square Enix]], released on January 21, 2016 and discontinued on June 17, 2020. An offline version was released, which retains the cutscenes but removes the gameplay system entirely.

An anime adaptation premiered from January 10 to March 28, 2019 (called Grimms Notes The Animation), which only covered less than the first quarter of the game's main story.

h4. See also

* [[List of Grimms Notes characters]]
* [[Grimms Echoes]]

h4. External links

title: fuu'un
body:
Fighing game series by [[SNK]]. 

The first game is called [b]Fuu'un Mokushiroku[/b] in Japan and [[Savage Reign]] elsewhere. 
This game is famous for its opening line: "[b]Fuu'un-Ken... A completely new art of fighting combined boomerang and karate art... [/b]" 

The second game is called [b]Fuu'un Super Tag Battle[/b] in Japan and [[Kizuna Encounter]] elsewhere. 
The setting of the games is the same as the [[Fatal Fury]] games but in the 21st century. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Savage Reign":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Savage_Reign

title: sung_jin-woo
body:
Sung Jin-Woo (성진우) is the main protagonist of the multimedia franchise [[Solo Leveling]]. Originally an infamously weak E-Rank Hunter, he got the chance of a lifetime when he was selected as the Player of the System, giving him the ability to grow stronger without limit. As a result, by taking advantage of the opportunities offered to him by the System, Jinwoo eventually rose to power as the new Shadow Monarch and the strongest hunter in the world.
Later in the series, he would marry [spoiler]his hunter colleague [[Cha Hae-In]], who would give birth to their firstborn son, [[Sung Suho]][/spoiler].

title: borsalino_(kizaru)
body:
[b]Admiral Kizaru[/b] (real name: [b]Borsalino[/b]) is an Admiral of the Marines in the world of [[One Piece]].

Having consumed the Pika Pika no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], he has the power to turn into and control light. [spoiler]He is also currently the only admiral on the Timeskip from the previous generation.[/spoiler]

title: lee_joo-hee
body: A supporting character from the South Korean multimedia franchise [[Solo Leveling]]. She was a B-rank healer, but was unable to continue as a hunter due to a severe mental trauma from a dungeon raid gone terribly wrong (the very raid during which [[Sung Jin-Woo]] was granted his special powers).

title: jingliu_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. A member of the [[High-Cloud Quintet (honkai: star rail)|]], voiced by [[Kuwashima Houko]] (JP) and [[Amanda Lee]] (EN). 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] that is tied into a [[ponytail]], [[red eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[blue dress]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[detached sleeves]], [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[hair ribbon]], [[black gloves]], [[black blindfold]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[knee boots]]. 

h4. Skins
* !post #7691288: Default
* !post #7484064: [[Jingliu (Star Rail Live 2024) (honkai: star rail)|Star Rail Live 2024]]

h4. Profile
[expand]
Former Sword Champion of the Luofu, and the creator of the Cloud Knights' legends of undefeated might.
Now, her name has been wiped from the records, and she is a traitor of the Xianzhou walking on the fine line between sanity and mara-struck.
"Whoever wishes to learn my swordplay, I will teach them."

One of the legendary heroes making up the the High-Cloud Quintet, and bestowed with the title "Transcendent Flash."

Having ascended beyond mortal concepts of victory, she chose to walk a different path to obtain the power capable of slaying gods.

Thereafter, one Sword Champion of the Luofu was removed from the Xianzhou's records, and one nameless traitor was added.
[/expand]

title: yumizuka_satsuki
body:
A character that appears in [[Tsukihime]] and [[Melty Blood]]. She is [[Tohno Shiki]]'s classmate who after an incident develops an unrequited one-sided crush on him, but in return he doesn't notice her much and just sees her as another classmate. She tragically turns into a [[vampire]]. 

Usually portrayed as a girl in [[school uniform]] with a [[two side up]] hairstyle and [[red eyes]].

title: saber_(fate)
body:
A character from [[Fate/stay night]], [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]], [[Fate/Zero]], and [[Fate/Extella]]. Saber is the female lead character of [[Fate/stay night]].

A petite teenage girl with [[blonde hair]] tied up in a [[single hair bun]] with a [[bun with braided base|braid]], [[green eyes]] and a distinctive [[ahoge]]. Often seen wielding a [[sword]] and wearing [[armored dress]], or a white [[blouse]] and a blue [[skirt]]. The Fate/Zero version is often drawn wearing a black [[business suit]] and hair tied in a [[ponytail]]. In [[Fate/stay night]], her chronological age is approximately in the late twenties, but she appears to be around fifteen, as her physical aging was stopped by magic in the "Sword in the Stone" event until her death in her original timeline.

True Name: [[Artoria Pendragon (fate)|]], a [[genderswap]]ped version of [[King Arthur (mythology)|King Arthur]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kawasumi Ayako]]

title: love_live!_superstar!!
body:
The fourth installment of the [[Love Live!]] franchise, set at Yuigaoka Girls' High School, near Omotesando, Harajuku, and Aoyama. 

It follows Liella!, a school idol group in the newly minted Yuigaoka, in their attempts to claim victory in the Love Live! national tournament.

It is the second installment to introduce new members after the series has started, and the first to have a third season.

title: ankha_zone_(meme)
body:
[b]Ankha Zone[/b] refers to an animation by [[Zone (artist)|]] (post #4351473) in tribute to an animation by [[Minuspal]] (post #4789190) featuring [[Ankha (animal crossing)|]] from [i][[Animal Crossing]][/i] having [[femdom]] [[sex]] with a [[Villager (animal crossing)|]] whilst keeping an [[expressionless|expressionless face]] and having her [[crossed arms|arms crossed]].

Parodies will often either include the character looking down on the viewer and swaying their hips to the music ("Camel by Camel" by [[Sandy Marton]], or in the case of the original minuspal animation, "Tower Power Pokey" from [[Paper Mario: Sticker Star]]), or emphasize Ankha's magic powers as displayed in the short animation.

h4. See also

* [[Egyptian Trend (meme)]] - 2025 animation meme

title: hybrid_insector
body:
A [[Kamen Rider]] fanfic webcomic series created by [[Shimizu Eiichi]] and [[Shimoguchi Tomohiro]], the authors of [[Kurogane no Linebarrel]]. 
Toei made a formal request to them in December 2011 for removing the comics from their site and the series was deleted without being completed. 

In the story, the government has decided to treat the Shouwa Kamen Riders as "vermin to be hunted down", right after the great evil was destroyed in the late 1980's.
other_names: ハイブリッド・インセクター

title: vrchat
body:
[b]VRChat[/b] is a [[virtual reality]] MMO video game by Graham Gaylor and Jesse Joudrey.

It involves players from around the world interacting with each other using VR models.

Despite its name, no [[head-mounted display|VR headset]] is required to play.

title: liliruca_arde
body:
A character in the [[dungeon_ni_deai_wo_motomeru_no_wa_machigatteiru_darou_ka|Danmachi]] franchise. She is of a fantasy race with very short stature and works as an assistant for adventurers.

Primarily her job is picking up dropped items from the monsters. She has stated that her small physique limits her combat ability greatly. In spite of her height she still has a notable bust. She has brown hair of varying length. Normally wears a cloak over a tight red top and short skirt which doesn't cover her waist. Her red top also includes a hood. 

There's confusion on how to romanize her name. "[[Liliruca Arde]]" is the most commonly used. Other variants are "Liliruka Aede", "Liliruca Aade" and "Liliruka Aade" 

Voiced by [[Uchida Maaya]].

h4. External links

* "DanMachi Wiki: Liliruca Arde":[https://danmachi.fandom.com/wiki/Liliruca_Arde]

title: hanae_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Member of the Remedial Knights. Her full name is Asagao Hanae.

She has [[blue eyes]], a [[pink halo]], [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]], tied into [[twintails]], decorated with [[hairclip]]s and [[crossed bandaids|crossed]] [[bandaid hair ornament|bandaid]] and [[pill hair ornament]]s, a [[skin fang]] and [[large breasts]].

Her regular outfit consists of a [[nurse cap]], a [[white choker]], a [[short dress|short]] [[black dress|black]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[white sailor collar]], a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[pink jacket]] with an [[armband]] held with a [[safety pin]], [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] thighhighs (a [[pink thighhighs|pink]] [[striped thighhighs|stripped]] one and a [[white thighhighs|white]] one) a [[thigh holster|thigh]] [[syringe]] [[syringe holster|holster]] and [[mismatched footwear|mismatched]] shoes. She also carries a [[stuffed rabbit]].

Her personal weapon is an [[L85]] [[assault rifle]].

Voiced by: [[Yuuki Kana (voice actor)|]]
Original artist: [[tonito]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #6496286: [[Hanae (Christmas) (blue archive)|Christmas]]
