title: dongtan_dress
body:
A [[tight clothes|tight]], muted color (typically [[grey dress|grey]] or [[black dress|black]]) [[pencil dress]] with low neckline to show [[cleavage]], usually accompanied with an open, [[cropped jacket]] of the same color. The [[long sleeves]] may alternatively be part of the dress. A [[meme attire|fashion meme]] originating from South Korea.

In South Korea, it is often joked on the Internet that the new town area of Dongtan (동탄) in Hwaseong, Gyeonggi has an unusually high number of rich, young married women wearing such dresses, spending time at shopping malls or cafes while their husbands are at work. Dongtan New Town is statistically one of the youngest in the country in terms of average age of residents, with one district scoring as low as 33.5 in September 2023. The township has been perceived as where a number of young married couples wishing to keep the capital area in close reach reside, where most infrastructures of South Korea are concentrated at an extreme density.

The meme has gained traction in 2023 and the name Dongtan has since been used on any young woman dressed in any revealing clothes, practically replacing any sexually suggestive keyword in Korea, with characters such as [[Dongtan Lady (k pring)|]] popping up.

h4. Examples
* !post #6724776: Default
* !post #7627481: [[Sleeveless dress|Sleeveless]] version

title: italian_brainrot_ai_animals_(meme)
body:
A series of "brainrot" memes involving [[ai-generated_art_(topic)|AI-generated]] images depicting [[fusion]]s of [[animal]]s, [[plant]]s, and objects, often with human [[feet]]. 
The "Italian" refers to the male Italian text-to-speech voiceover generally used, as the meme evolved gradually on [[TikTok]] in early 2025.

Notable examples include: 
* [[Tralalero Tralala]]: a [[shark]] wearing 3 [[nike (company)|Nike]] [[sneaker]]s
* [[Brr Brr Patapim]]: a giant creature with the head of a [[proboscis monkey|proboscis]] [[monkey]], [[tree]]-like limbs and large human [[feet]]
* [[Bombardiro Crocodilo]]: a [[bomber]] [[airplane]] with a [[crocodile]] head
* [[Tung Tung Tung Sahur]]: an anthropomorphized wooden log holding a [[baseball bat]] (with Indonesian language voiceover) 
* [[Lirili Larila]]: a giant creature with the head of an [[elephant]] and body resembling a [[saguaro]] [[cactus]], wearing [[sandals]]
* !post #9147579
h4. External links:
* "Know Your Meme":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/italian-brainrot-ai-italian-animals]

title: down_boy!!_(meme)
body:
A redraw [[meme]] referencing a panel from [[Archie]]’s Girls Betty and Veronica #235 in which [[Veronica Lodge]] demonstrates her control over [[Archie Andrews]] by making him sit and bark like a dog by screaming "Down Boy!!". Archie responds by squatting, holding his hands up in a [[paw pose]], and says "Arf!".

h4. Panel
* !asset #25122094



h4. External Links

* "KnowYourMeme: 'Down Boy!!' 'Arf!'":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/down-boy-arf]

title: solo_leveling
body:
[b][i]Solo Leveling[/b][/i], also alternatively translated as [b][i]Only I Level Up[/b][/i], is a South Korean web novel written by Chugong. It was serialized in KakaoPage beginning on July 25, 2016. It received a webtoon adaptation in 2018, and an anime television series adaptation by A-1 Pictures premiered in Q1 2024.

title: underbust
body:
Clothing worn under the bustline, lifting or accentuating the [[breasts]]. The top edge of the outer garment should ideally rest just underneath the bust. 

h4. Examples
* !post #2401122
* !post #8853038

Some clothing styles that incorporate this feature are [[maid]] uniforms, [[waitress]] uniforms (particularly from the [[Anna Miller]] and [[Kobeya]] restaurant chains), the [[dirndl]], most [[corset]]s, and the [[virgin killer outfit]].

[[Dress ribbon]] and [[rei no himo]] tied directly under the breasts also count as underbust.

For clothing that encloses all sides of the bust, use [[framed breasts]]. 

Not to be confused with [[underboob]], which refers to the exposed bottom part of the breasts.

h4. See also

* [[chest harness]]
* [[corset]]
* [[dirndl]]
* [[empire waist]]
* [[framed breasts]]
* [[high-waist skirt]]
* [[maid]]
* [[virgin killer outfit]]
* [[waitress]]

title: great_mother_temptation
body: The concept of the "Great Mother" in the context of femininity refers to the archetype of the mother, often associated with both nurturing and potentially dangerous aspects of the feminine. This archetype, explored by Carl Jung, suggests a duality in feminine power, encompassing both love and seduction, vulnerability and mystery. In this context, the "temptation" can be seen as the pull of these powerful, sometimes overwhelming, aspects of the feminine, which can lead to both positive and negative outcomes.

title: futsuu_no_keion-bu
body:
[i]Futsuu no Keion-bu[/i] (lit. "Ordinary Light Music Club"), also known as [i]Girl meets Rock![/i] in the English localization, is a 2024-to-present manga written by "Kuwahali":[https://x.com/kuwahali] and illustrated by [[denai tetsuo|Ideuchi Tetsuo]].
The story follows 15-years old [[Hatono Chihiro]]'s musical journey as she pick ups the electric guitar and joins her high school's light music club. In spite of the series' title, she soon discovers that the club is anything but ordinary.

title: red_len
body:
An alternative version of [[Tsukihime]]/[[Melty Blood]]'s [[Len (tsukihime)|]] created by [[lycoris_(redandblack)|Lycoris]] as a [[m.u.g.e.n]] character. Her offensive specialty is [[pyrokinesis]], and is often paired with [[Idagawa Ren]]. 

Her color scheme is a red and black outfit with a purple hair bow (often worn [[low-tied_long_hair|lower]] in fan art to make her more visually distinct from the original Lens), [[purple eyes]] and [[grey hair|grey]] or [[white hair]]. 

Originally created as a familiar, she lives and works at an antique shop, but otherwise acts independently. She enjoys smoking and drinking (especially bourbon). 
* !post #2022173

title: mega_man_x_dive
body:
Mega Man X DiVE is a mobile platform game from the [[Mega Man X (series)|]] series. It was released on March 2020 and ended services on July 2024. An offline version of the game was released on September 2023 on Steam.

The game follows the story of the Player and a navigator of the "Deep Log", [[RiCO (mega man)|]]. Deep Log is where the game data of the Player are stored as well as the data of the beloved game series Mega Man X.

The Player works alongside RiCO to fix the anomalies that happened within the Deep Log that is causing the corruption of the Mega Man X games, causing the data of various games within and outside of the X series to get mingled together.

h4. New characters
* [[RiCO (mega man)|]]
* [[ViA (mega man)|]]
* [[iCO (megaman x dive)|]]
* [[Droitclair]]
* [[Eratoeir (mega man x dive)|]]
* [[Angepitoyeir]]

h4. External links

* "Steam: MEGA MAN X DiVE Offline":[https://store.steampowered.com/app/2183650/MEGA_MAN_X_DiVE_Offline/]

title: lalabell_lullaby
body:
A Spanish-speaking [[Virtual YouTuber]] part of the 1st generation of [[Idol Corp|Idol]]'s ES branch called "EternalS". She was designed by [[Muryotaro]].

She's a [[Magical girl|maho shoujo]] [[rabbit girl]], wearing a [[white dress|white]] [[layered dress]], white [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[purple bowtie]] with a [[rabbit brooch|rabbit-shaped brooch]], and [[mini wings]]. She also wears [[white gloves]] and [[mary janes]]. Her legwear is [[asymmetrical legwear|asymmetrical]] with a [[frilled thigh strap]], [[ankle garter]], [[leg ribbon]], [[red footwear|red shoe]]  on one side, and [[bandaid on leg|multiple]] [[bandaid on knee|bandaids]], a [[loose socks|loose sock]] and a [[pink footwear|pink shoe]] on the other.

She has [[pink eyes]]. For her default hairstyle, she has [[very long hair|very long]] [[split-color hair|split-color]] [[pink hair|pink]] and [[white hair|white]] hair with some [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[hair rings]] a [[star ahoge]], [[braid|braids]] and [[hair ribbon|ribbons]]

h4. External Links

title: x_(mega_man)
body:
The main protagonist of the [[Mega Man X (series)|]] series. X also serves as a guide during the [[Mega Man Zero (series)|]] series as [[Cyber Elf X (mega man)|]] and appears as Biometal [[Model X (mega man)|]] in the [[Mega Man ZX]] series. 

He is the successor of the original [[Mega Man (character)|]] and is [[dr. light (mega man)|Dr. Thomas Light's]] greatest creation. Throughout the X series, X is an Maverick Hunter who fights alongside his partners [[zero (mega man)|Zero]] and [[Axl (mega man)|]] in order to maintain peace and stability in the world and protect humans and Reploids alike from Mavericks, though X would like nothing better than the opportunity to stop fighting. Because of his aversion to violence, X is initially ranked a B-Class Hunter, but he is eventually promoted to S-Class.

title: mu_(orguss)
body:
A fictional, hostile [[robot]] race from the [[Choujikuu Seiki Orguss]] [[mecha]] anime [[science fiction]] TV series from the 80s. They are the main antagonists in the show.

The [b]Mu[/b] are a very advanced robotic civilization that possess a massive army of several powerful combat [[spacecraft]], fighter [[aircraft]] and several different [[mecha]]. [spoilers]They come from an [[alternate_universe|alternate dimension]] where an "A.I. singularity":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Technological_singularity caused advanced robots to rebel and erradicate the human race. The Mu robot race are the result of this catasthrophic apocalyptic event.[/spoilers]

h4.See also

* [[Mome (Orguss)]]
* [[Taii]]

title: padme_amidala
body:
A [[Star Wars]] character played by [[Natalie Portman]]. She first appeared in [[Star Wars: The Phantom Menace |The Phantom Menace]] as the teenage Queen of Naboo, and after her reign, becomes a senator and an anti-war activist in the Galactic Senate. 

[spoiler]She secretly marries [[Anakin Skywalker]], then later dies while giving birth to twins [[Luke Skywalker]] and [[Princess Leia|Leia Organa]]. Anakin's fear of losing Padmé serves as the catalyst in driving him to the dark side of the Force and becoming [[Darth Vader]].[/spoiler]

title: kikou_souseiki_mospeada
body:
[b]Kikou Souseiki Mospeada[/b] (機甲創世記モスピーダ lit. [b]Armored Genesis Mospeada[/b], known in English as [i][b]Genesis Climber Mospeada[/b][/i]) is a [[science fiction]] [[mecha]] anime TV series created by Aramaki Shinji and Kakinuma Hideki. It is the first series of the [[MOSPEADA]] franchise.

The 25-episode television series ran from late 1983 to early 1984 in Japan. The show is set in the year 2083, when the Earth faces an alien occupation that has lasted 33 years.

[[Mospeada (mecha)|]] stands for "[b]M[/b]ilitary [b]O[/b]peration [b]S[/b]oldier [b]P[/b]rotection [b]E[/b]mergency [b]A[/b]viation [b]D[/b]ive [b]A[/b]rmor", one of the transformable [[motorcycle]]-[[power armor]]s the series features. 

The other primary mecha featured in the show are the three-form transformable fighter called the Armo-Fighter AFC-01 [[Legioss]] and another three form heavy mecha called AB-01 [[Tread]].

All the human and alien mechanical designs for the series were created by [[Aramaki Shinji]] and [[Kakinuma Hideki]] respectively.

Mospeada became [b][i]The New Generation[/i][/b] in the [[ROBOTECH]] American adaptation of the series.

h4. Characters

title: choujikuu_kidan_southern_cross
body:
[i][b]Choujikuu Kidan Setan Kurosu[/b][/i], known in English as [i][b]The Super Dimension Cavalry Southern Cross[/b][/i], was the third Japanese [[science fiction|Sci-Fi]] [[mecha]] anime series released under the "Super Dimension" moniker by the sponsor [[Big West]]. It aired weekly from April 15, 1984 until September 30, 1984.

The Southern Cross followed [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross|The Super Dimension Fortress Macross]] (1982-1983) created by Studio Nue with Artland and produced by Tatsunoko, and [[Choujikuu Seiki Orguss|The Super Dimension Century Orguss]] (1983-1984), also created by Studio Nue with Artland and produced by Tokyo Movie Shinsha.

The three titles share some of the same creators and staff, and [[MACROSS]] is referenced by character cameos and inside references by the latter two series. However, the basic stories are unrelated. Southern Cross was the least successful of the 'Super Dimensional' banner and was actually canceled due to low ratings, forcing the scriptwriters to hastily conclude the anime. The series lasted for 23 episodes. 

Unlike the other two series, The Southern Cross was created and produced almost entirely by [[tatsunoko_pro|Tatsunoko]] with mechanical designs by its sister studio Ammonite (Ogawa Hiroshi, Ohkura Hirotoshi and Ono Takashi). The characters of the show were designed by [[Kogawa Tomonori]], [[Kitazume Hiroyuki]] and Sonoda Miyo.

Most of the animation of The Southern Cross (with edited content and revised dialogue) was adapted outside Japan for the second part of [[ROBOTECH]], following [b]The Macross Saga[/b], and preceding [b]The New Generation[/b]. In this form, it is frequently referred to as [b]Robotech Masters[/b] (as it was titled in the comic book adaptation released by Comico) or also [b]The Masters Saga[/b].

title: robotech
body:
The North American adaptation/westernification of [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross|Super Dimension Fortress Macross]], [[Choujikuu Kidan Southern Cross|Super Dimension Cavalry Southern Cross]], and [[Kikou Souseiki Mospeada|Genesis Climber Mospeada]] -- actually an edited amalgamation of the three original (and unrelated) Japanese anime series, with their plots significantly altered to appear as though they comprise a single continuous storyline. 

The ROBOTECH adaptation also featured modified dialogue and different music (by "Ulpio Minucci":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ulpio_Minucci]), which was developed by an American company called [[Harmony Gold]] and producer and story editor "Carl Macek":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Macek]. It was first syndicated to American TV stations in 1985 and a few years later in several other countries across the world. It was quite popular during its first time of release in the West, as many anime fans of that era thought it was made of original content (which it wasn't).

Historically, [b]ROBOTECH has been an extremely polarizing subject amongst [[otaku|anime fans]], and it remains controversial even to this day[/b].

Many critics look down upon the show for its extensive edits to the source material (Westernizing character names, editing for content, forging a connection between previously-unrelated series, and so on), to the extent that some of its most ardent detractors compare it to the Woody Allen film "[i]What's Up, Tiger Lily?[/i]":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/What%27s_Up,_Tiger_Lily%3F, a Japanese spy thriller completely redubbed and re-edited to become a campy musical comedy.  

On the other hand, the series does have its staunch defenders as well, most of whom will cite the fact that the adaptation had a new original epic and memorable music soundtrack and that it served as an important "gateway" to anime (particularly the [[mecha]] genre) for many Americans (and other Westerners) who grew up in the [[1980s (style)|80s]]. 

After several legal disputes over the international rights of the original series ([[MACROSS]] mostly) a settlement was reached between the parties in 2021 and now both the original and adapted series will be freely available everywhere in the world, allowing western anime fans to know more about the original franchises and the Japanese to watch the adaptation and purchase their respective merchandise without any legal constrains for the first time.

This tag should be used sparingly, and [i]only[/i] on pictures that are clearly intended to depict or reflect the ROBOTECH version of events. Otherwise, the tags for the original three series should instead be used:

* [b]The Macross Saga[/b]: [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]]
* [b]The Masters Saga[/b]: [[Choujikuu Kidan Southern Cross]]
* [b]The New Generation[/b]: [[Kikou Souseiki Mospeada]]

Also note that the American-produced anime film [[The Shadow Chronicles]] is considered part of the ROBOTECH universe, but not that of any of the original Japanese series.

h4. See also

* [[Rick Hunter]]
* [[Lisa Hayes]]
* [[Dana Sterling]]
* [[Rook Bartley]]

* [[Itano circus]]

* [[Robotech: Love Live Alive]]

* [[Robotech: The Motion Picture]]

* [[Robotech: Force of Arms]]

title: britomart_(fate)
body:
Lancer-class Servant introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She is the daughter of the female knight who features in Edmund Spenser's epic poem [i]The Fairy Queene[/i], particularly in Book III where she is the embodiment of Chastity.  On account of the Fate version of her mother being turned into a fairy after her adventures, this Britomart has been a fairy since birth.

title: microman
body:
Takara's 70s toy series, alternatively called Micronauts abroad. Known as one of two toy lines (specifically the 1982 New Microman [i]"Micro Change":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Micro_Change [/i]subline), along with [[Diaclone]], from which the earliest G1 [[Transformers]] toys came.
Takara Tomy would revive the series once a decade since.

title: ookami_(game)
body:
[i]Ookami[/i] is a game developed by the now closed Clover Studios, a former subsidiary of Capcom.

[i]Ookami[/i] follows the story of the sun god [[Amaterasu (ookami)|]], who is in the form of a white wolf and accompanied by the diminutive [[Issun]] as she battles evil demons such as [[Yamata no Orochi (ookami)|]].

The unique graphics of the game make it seem like a painting on a scroll. Using the Celestial Brush, Amaterasu can use her powers to alter reality, such as drawing a line to cut something in half, drawing a bomb to blow something up, and filling in areas to restore broken or missing objects.

The title of the game is a pun. "Okami" means "great deity", but with a different character system, it can also mean "wolf".

Has a [[Nintendo DS]] sequel, [i][[Ookamiden]][/i]. Amaterasu has made a playable appearance in [i][[Marvel vs. Capcom 3]][/i].

title: kino_makoto
body:
The brown-haired character from the series [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]] (aka. Pretty Soldier Sailor Moon) by [[Takeuchi Naoko]]. She is physically [[muscular female|very strong]], and the [[height difference|tallest girl]] compared to her close friends. She's also noted for having the [[large breasts|largest bust]] among her friends (who are rather curvy in their own right).

Despite her tough appearance, she is very gentle. She is also a good cook and signed up for home economics.

Voiced by the late [[Shinohara Emi]] in the 90s anime, and [[Koshimizu Ami]] in Crystal.

title: illya_(princess_connect!)
body:
A [[Princess Connect!]] character and a member of the guild Diabolos. She appears in Princess Connect! Re:Dive.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[hair between eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[red eyes]]. She wears a [[white leotard|white]] [[strapless leotard]], [[red dress|red]] [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[frilled dress]] with a [[showgirl skirt]], [[fur-trimmed gloves|fur-trimmed]] [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], a [[fur-trimmed_cloak |fur-trimmed]] [[white cloak]], [[black thighhighs]], [[black choker]], and a red [[bonnet]].

She can shift from adult to [[illya (small) (princess connect!)|small]] forms.

h4. Official Costumes/Variants:

title: sailor_saturn
body:
She is one of the [[Outer Senshi]] from the series [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]] and the last planetary [[Sailor Senshi]] discovered. Of all the Sailor Senshi, Saturn makes the fewest appearances in the anime. Her civilian name is [[Tomoe Hotaru]].

She carries a scythe weapon called the [[Silence Glaive]] and a large part of her powers are associated with silence and destruction. Her two most notable offensive moves are [[Silence Glaive Surprise]] and [[Death Reborn Revolution]], plus a defensive Silence Wall move.

h4. See also

* [[Super Sailor Saturn]]
* [[Super Sailor Saturn (Stars)]]

title: death_reborn_revolution
body:
An attack used by [[Sailor Saturn]]. It is never seen in the 90s anime, but is seen in the [[bishoujo senshi sailor moon s|third season]]’s final battle against [[Pharaoh 90]] in both the manga and [[bishoujo senshi sailor moon crystal|Crystal]]. This is an extremely powerful attack that causes purple ribbons to swirl around Saturn’s [[Silence Glaive]], generating strong winds that decimate anything in their path. It is strong enough to suck Pharaoh 90 out of the earth, forcing him to try and return to his home world to escape her.

Note that there is a separate attack called [i]Death Ribbon Revolution[/i], but the katakana for [i]ribbon[/i] (リボン) is slightly different from [i]reborn[/i] (リボーン), and the move only shows up in a fighting game. They appear visually similar, so the [i]reborn[/i] variant originating from the manga is used here.
other_names: デス・リボーン・レボリューション

title: voltron_(series)
body:
A United States dub and combination of two unrelated science fiction anime - [i][[Hyakujuu-ou Golion]][/i] and [i][[Kikou Kantai Dairugger XV]][/i] -  that originally ran from 1983 to 1985, produced by World Events Productions. World Events Productions created original western-produced installments in the franchise, and later acquired the rights to both of the original Japanese series used to create the first Voltron.

It stars the titular [[mecha]] [[Voltron (mecha)|]], the name being used to refer to the titular mechas of the original series Voltron is based on, [[Golion (mecha)|]] and [[Dairugger XV (mecha)|]].

h4. Works in the [i]Voltron[/i] series

* [i][[hyakujuu-ou golion|Voltron: Defender of the Universe]][/i]
* [i][[kikou kantai dairugger xv|Voltron: Fleet of Doom]][/i]
* [i]Voltron: The Third Dimension[/i]
* [i][[Voltron Force]][/i]
* [i][[Voltron: Legendary Defender]][/i]

title: shinko_windy_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. Resident "biting girl" of the series.

Windy is easily excitable and has a tendency to bite other characters when agitated. Her verbal tic is "~nanoda" (like [[common_raccoon_(kemono_friends)|Raccoon]] from [[Kemono Friends]]). She loves playing pranks (specifically on [[Trainer (Umamusume)|]]s).

Windy's real-life horse counterpart has a nasty habit of biting other horses when racing neck-to-neck near the finish line. This has lost him several races with the horse being "too busy" trying to line up a bite instead of overtaking his opponent. This trait endears him to his fans, oddly.

h4. Appearance
* !post #3076186: [[Tracen School Uniform]]
* !post #7608263: Racing Outfit 
* !post #3076188: Racing Outfit (Draft)
* !post #6044154: [[starting_future_(umamusume)|Starting Future]]

* "Horse JP Keiba: Shinko Windy":[https://horsejpkeiba.com/shinko-windy/]

title: der_untergang
body:
The original German title of Oliver Hirschbiegel's 2004 war film [b]Downfall[/b], depicting the final days of [[World War II]] in [[Nazi]] [[Germany]] and the life of [[Adolf Hitler]] and his aides inside the Berlin bunker. Notable for a scene in which Hitler is informed by his generals that his ordered counterattack on the approaching [[Soviet Army|Soviet forces]] did not take place, causing him to furiously rant about how everyone, particularly his military staff, has failed him. Other scenes of him or others ranting have resulted in parodies with altered subtitles in which they rant about anything, creating a meme.

h4.See also
* [[meme]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Downfall (2004 film)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Downfall_%282004_film%29#Parodies
* "Know Your Meme: [Downfall / Hitler Reacts]":http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/downfall-hitler-reacts
* "Nicopedia: [film]":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/4161366 "[parodies]":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/306077

title: phase_connect
body:
[i]Next generation virtual entertainment. Content delivery using virtual avatars - Vtubers. Let's go down the rabbit hole together![/i]

A [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] company based in Canada, featuring both English and Japanese-speaking members. Members of Invader waves were either formerly part of other agencies and retained their characters, or have extensive experience under a previous persona.

title: help:dtext
body:
[expand=Table of Contents] * "Basic formatting":#dtext-basic-formatting * "Links":#dtext-links * "Links Using ID":#dtext-id-links * "Images":#dtext-images * "Paragraphs":#dtext-paragraphs * "Horizontal Rules":#dtext-horizontal-rules * "Headings":#dtext-headings * "Quotes":#dtext-quotes * "Lists":#dtext-lists * "Expands":#dtext-expands * "Tables":#dtext-tables * "HTML":#dtext-html [/expand] DText is the name of Danbooru's custom text formatting language. It's a mishmash of several markup languages, including "BBCode":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BBCode], "MediaWiki":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:Wikitext], "Markdown":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markdown], and "HTML":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTML#Markup]. h4#basic-formatting. Basic formatting
What you type What you get Notes
[code][b]bold[/b][/code] bold
[code][i]italics[/i][/code] italics
[code][u]underline[/u][/code] underline
[code][s]strikethrough[/s][/code] strikethrough
[code][tn]note[/tn][/code] note
[code][spoilers]ssh![/spoilers][/code] [spoilers]ssh![/spoilers]
[code][nodtext][u]nodtext[/u][/nodtext][/code] [nodtext][u]nodtext[/u][/nodtext] Ignore DText tags
[code][co[/code][code]de][u]code[/u][/co[/code][code]de][/code] [code][u]code[/u][/code] Ignore DText and format as code
[code]line[br]break[/code] line[br]break [tn]Insert a line break[br](Allows line breaks to be specified in line)[/tn]
h4#links. Links
What you type What you get Notes
[code]https://danbooru.donmai.us[/code] https://danbooru.donmai.us [tn]Basic link[/tn]
[code][/code] [tn]Basic link with delimiters[/tn]
[code]"Danbooru":[https://danbooru.donmai.us][/code] "Danbooru":[https://danbooru.donmai.us] [tn]Link with custom text[/tn]
[code][Danbooru](https://danbooru.donmai.us)[/code] [Danbooru](https://danbooru.donmai.us) [tn]Markdown style link[/tn]
[code][https://danbooru.donmai.us](Danbooru)[/code] [https://danbooru.donmai.us](Danbooru) [tn]Reverse Markdown style link[/tn]
[code]Danbooru[/code] Danbooru [tn]HTML style link[/tn]
[code][url]https://danbooru.donmai.us[/url][/code] [url]https://danbooru.donmai.us[/url] [tn]BBCode style link[/tn]
[code][url=https://danbooru.donmai.us]Danbooru[/url][/code] [url=https://danbooru.donmai.us]Danbooru[/url] [tn]BBCode style link with custom text[/tn]
[code]"ToS":[/terms_of_service][/code] "ToS":[/terms_of_service] [tn]Link to a Danbooru page
Note: Substitute [ and ] in links with %5B and %5D to avoid format breaking[/tn]
[code]"Here":[#dtext-basic-formatting][/code] "Here":[#dtext-basic-formatting] [tn]Link to a specific section of the current page[/tn]
[code][[Kantai Collection]][/code] [[Kantai Collection]] [tn]Link to a wiki[/tn]
[code][[Kantai Collection#External-links]][/code] [[Kantai Collection#External-links]] [tn]Link to a specific section of a wiki article
Note: The first letter of the anchor must be capitalized when using this link syntax
Note: When the link is parsed, the anchor will be converted to lowercase
Note: When the link is parsed, "[code]dtext-[/code]" will be prepended to the anchor[/tn]
[code][[Kantai Collection|Kancolle]][/code] [[Kantai Collection|Kancolle]] [tn]Link to a wiki with custom text[/tn]

h4#paragraphs. Paragraphs Paragraphs are separated by blank lines. A single line break inside a paragraph creates a new line instead of a new paragraph. h4#horizontal-rules. Horizontal rules Use [code][hr][/code] on a line by itself to create a horizontal rule, like this: [hr] h4#headings. Headings Use [code]h4. text[/code], [code]h5. text[/code], or [code]h6. text[/code] to create a heading: h4. [nodtext]h4. Heading[/nodtext] h5. [nodtext]h5. Heading[/nodtext] h6. [nodtext]h6. Heading[/nodtext] h4#quotes. Quotes [code] [quote] Chiyo-dad said: I wish I were a bird. [/quote] [/code] Becomes: [quote] Chiyo-dad said: I wish I were a bird. [/quote] Quotes can be nested: [code] [quote] [quote] Hello everyone~! [/quote] Oh my gah! [/quote] [/code] Becomes: [quote] [quote] Hello everyone~! [/quote] Oh my gah! [/quote] h4#lists. Lists Start a line with an '*' to make a list: [code] * Item 1 * Item 2 ** Item 2.a ** Item 2.b * Item 3 [/code] Becomes: * Item 1 * Item 2 ** Item 2.a ** Item 2.b * Item 3 h4#expands. Expands Use [code][expand][/code] to create collapsible blocks of text: [code] [expand] Text that is hidden by default. Click the "Show" button to expand the block and make the text visible. [/expand] [/code] Becomes: [expand] This text is hidden by default. Clicking the "Show" button will expand the block. [/expand] Use [code][expand=Custom title][/code] to add a custom title: [code] [expand=Custom title] This text is hidden by default. Clicking the "Show" button will expand the block. [/expand] [/code] Becomes: [expand=Custom title] This text is hidden by default. Clicking the "Show" button will expand the block. [/expand] h4#tables. Tables Use HTML table tags to make a table. body:

Combine with [[mascot head]] only if the head is detached and visible in frame.

title: plants_vs_zombies
body:
Plants vs. Zombies is a tower defense and strategy video game developed and originally published by PopCap Games for Windows and OS X in May 2009.

In Plants vs. Zombies, players take the role of a homeowner in the midst of a zombie apocalypse. To defend their home from zombies, some which have unique abilities, the player uses plants that can fire projectiles at, give "sun" to purchase other plants to help or block the advancing zombies. Players must plan defenses in multiple "lanes" across the home's lawn and should a zombie make it to the house on any lane, the game is over. Director George Fan was inspired to make the game after playing other tower defense titles and desiring to eliminate the typical strategies of sending advancing enemies through mazes of defenses, instead adapting the lane approach to remove this strategy.

* [[Crazy Dave_(plants_vs_zombies)|]]

title: twintails
body:
A hair style where the hair is tied into sections forming two ponytails. The Japanese term for this type of hair style is ツインテール (twin tail).

All of the hair must be tied into two pigtails for this tag to count. If any hair outside of the bangs/[[sidelocks]] falls normally, it is [[two side up]] instead.

Not to be confused with [[multiple tails]] which relates to beings with more than one tail of the animal variety.

h4. Notable twintail characters

* [[Hatsune Miku]] (of [[VOCALOID]])
* [[Black Rock Shooter (character)|The eponymous character]] of [[Black Rock Shooter]]
* [[Fate Testarossa]] (of [[Lyrical Nanoha]], only when transformed)
* [[Nakano Azusa]] (of [[K-ON!]])

title: silvervale
body:
An English-speaking [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]]. Originally an [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]], she later became one of the founding members of [[VShojo]], until leaving to return being an indie on April 26, 2023. She is the (non-IRL) significant other to VShojo virtual YouTuber [[Vei (vtuber)|]], having married to each other in [[Final Fantasy XIV]] in February 2021.

Being a [[wolf girl]] she naturally has [[wolf ears]] (although she sometimes wears [[animal ear headphones|wolf ear headphones]]), a [[pink tail|pink]] and [[blue tail|blue]] [[wolf tail]], [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair|pink]] and [[blue hair|blue]] [[gradient hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and [[blue eyes]].

title: silvervale_(gyaru)
body:
The 12th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of the [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Silvervale]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/crimsongrain/status/1690137775901712384].

Going for a [[gyaru]]-style, she wears a [[crop top|cropped]] [[white shirt]], a [[lowleg skirt|lowleg]] [[pink skirt|pink]] [[miniskirt]], [[torn arm warmers|torn]] [[striped arm warmers]], [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] [[pink thighhighs|pink]] and [[blue thighhighs]] with a [[fishnet thighhighs|fishnet thighhigh]] [[layered legwear|layered]] on one leg as well as [[leg warmers]], [[white footwear|white]]  [[platform boots]], a [[pink necktie]], [[black panties|black]] [[high-waist panties]] and a [[black collar|black]] [[spiked collar]].

Her hair is also [[hair ornament|decorated]] with tons of [[character hair ornament|references]], such as having [[Creeper]] and [[shiny pokemon|shiny]] [[Umbreon]] [[character hair ornament|hair ornaments]], along with a [[Moogle]] [[charm (object)|]] on her [[belt chain]].

For the season, she wears a [[white skirt|white]] [[frilled skirt]], a [[red coat|red]] [[santa coat]], a [[santa hat]] on her right ear, [[white thighhighs]] and [[red footwear|red]] [[fur-trimmed boots]], paied with [[red lipstick]] and [[red eyeliner|eyeliner]].

title: bondage_mittens
body:
Pouch-like coverings that fasten securely around the wrists, holding the hands closed or palms flat. They are often used in [[BDSM]] play such as [[pony play]] or [[pet play]]. Unlike [[mittens]] for cold-weather use, bondage mittens are tubes or bags without a separate thumb and are typically made of [[leather]] or some other stiff material to prevent the wearer from grasping through the material of the mittens.

There are several specialised designs that differ from the standard look:

* !post #7966668: [[paw gloves|Paw mittens]]
* !post #7134904: [[hoof gloves|Hoof mittens]]
* !post #3506677: Metal mittens

h4. See also
* [[armbinder]]
* [[taped hands]]

h4. External links
"Wikipedia: Medical Restraints":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medical_restraint#Types]

title: ultra_galaxy_mega_dai-kaijuu_battle
body:
The 22nd and 23rd installments of the long-running [[Ultra Series]], and the start of the [[Ultra Galaxy (series)|]] sub-series. It adapts the concept of the [i]Dai-Kaijuu Battle: ULTRA MONSTERS[/i] [[carddass]] arcade game, itself the start of the Dai-Kaijuu Battle sub-series (covering the arcade games and ports, manga, and this show), and features an original plot.

Unlike previous entries, this show does not focus on Ultramen, instead focusing on [[kaiju]] battling each other, akin to [[Pokemon]] (itself inspired by [[Ultraseven (series)|]]'s Capsule Monsters). It follows the ZAP SPACY team, and in particular, [[Reimon]], a Reionic, who can summon kaiju to fight with using his Battlenizer.

h4. See also

* [[Dai-Kaijuu Battle Ultra Ginga Densetsu The Movie]]

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultra_Galaxy_Mega_Monster_Battle

title: atelier_(series)
body:
A series of alchemy-themed RPGs developed by [[Gust]].

Most games stars a heroine just starting in the alchemy business when an event occurs and they must develop their skills to solve the problem. 

The Atelier Iris trilogy, Mana Khemia duology and Atelier Escha & Logy (from the Dusk trilogy) are the only games with male protagonists.

h4.Games

* Salburg trilogy
** [[Atelier Marie]] (1997)
** [[Atelier Elie]] (1998)
** [[Atelier Lilie]] (2001)
* Gramnad duology
** [[Atelier Judie]] (2002)
** [[Atelier Viorate]] (2003)
* [[Atelier Iris|Iris trilogy]]
** [[atelier iris eternal mana|Atelier Iris: Eternal Mana]] (2004)
** [[atelier iris eternal mana 2|Atelier Iris 2: Azoth of Destiny]] (2005)
** [[atelier iris grand phantasm|Atelier Iris 3: Grand Phantasm]] (2006)
* [[Mana Khemia (series)|Mana Khemia duology]]
** [[Mana Khemia]] (2007)
** [[Mana Khemia 2]] (2008)
* Arland tetralogy
** [[Atelier Rorona]] (2009)
** [[Atelier Totori]] (2010)
** [[Atelier Meruru]] (2011)
** [[Atelier Lulua]] (2019)
* Dusk trilogy
** [[Atelier Ayesha]] (2012)
** [[Atelier Escha & Logy]] (2013)
** [[Atelier Shallie]] (2014)
* Mysterious tetralogy
** [[Atelier Sophie]] (2015)
** [[Atelier Sophie 2]] (2022)

title: martina_crespi
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches: Kurenai no Majo-tachi]].

A Sergeant from Romagna serving in the [[504th Joint Fighter Wing]]. Member of the Pantaloni Rossi trio with [[Luciana Mazzei]] and [[Fernandia Malvezzi]]. She studied ballet, but is more interested in soccer.
Her familiar is a Bolognese dog, her weapon is an MG42 machine gun, and she's based on Giampiero Crespi.

title: fernandia_malvezzi
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches: Kurenai no Majo-tachi]]. 

A Flying Officer from Romagna serving in the [[504th Joint Fighter Wing]]. Member of the Pantaloni Rossi trio with [[Luciana Mazzei]] and [[Martina Crespi]].
Her familiar is a marmot, her weapon is an MG42 machine gun, and she's based on Fernando Malvezzi.

title: president_parallel_susie
body:
A boss fought in [[Super Kirby Clash]]. She is a version of [[Susie (kirby)|]] from another dimension, much like [[Parallel Susie]], only with a more powerful moveset as well as being presented as the President of her equivalent of the Haltmann Works Company. 

Whether the two versions of the secretary are different entities or one and the same is unclear. Pres. Parallel Susie also lacks the original's gold hairclip, and has [[red eyes]], pale/[[grey skin]], [[white hair]] and maroon clothes. 
H4. See also
* [[Max Profitt Haltmann]]
* "WiKirby":https://wikirby.com/wiki/Pres._Parallel_Susie

title: merlin_(fate/prototype)
body:
The version of [[Merlin (fate)|]] from the universe of [i][[Fate/Prototype]][/i]. According to this universe's [[Arthur Pendragon (fate)|Saber]], this Merlin is actually female. 

She makes a vocal cameo in [i][[Fate/Grand Order]][/i] when Prototype Arthur uses his Noble Phantasm. Amusingly she is voiced by [[Kawasumi Ayako]], who voices Artoria (and her variants). 

She later made her first playable debut in [i][[Fate/Grand Order Arcade]][/i] in September 2020, establishing an official design.

In summer 2022, Prototype Merlin became a summonable [[lady avalon (fate)|Pretender-class Swimsuit Servant]] in [i]Fate/Grand Order[/i] itself, going under the alias [b]Lady Avalon[/b].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Taiki (luster)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kawasumi Ayako]]

title: saratoga_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the US Navy aircraft carrier USS [i]Saratoga[/i] (CV-3). 
Character designed by [[Saru]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]].

A jarringly young-looking girl with an equally childish and girly personality. She has [[long hair|long]], [[pink hair]] in [[twintails]] with an [[ahoge]] while wearing a [[hairband]] with a [[smokestack]]-like accessory. She wears a [[backless outfit|backless-like]], [[sleeveless dress]] with a [[black ribbon]] on it, and an attached cannon. Underneath it was a [[military uniform]] with an [[armband]]. She also wears [[black pantyhose]] and [[elbow gloves]] as well as carrying a [[staff]] with a [[flight deck]]-like banner. She has [[small breasts]] that she's conscious of compared to the much more endowed [[illustrious (azur lane)|Illustrious]] and [[Ranger (azur lane)|Ranger]]. The fact that she has them at all tends to be forgotten by others, including her own artist, [[Saru]] as seen in a number of her skins.

title: toyota_altezza
body: [[Car]] produced by [[Toyota]], also sold as the [[Lexus IS]] outside of Japan. The Altezza name was used for 1998 - 2005 models, and was replaced by its Lexus counterpart in Japan after being discontinued.

title: xu_fu_(fate)
body:
A Servant first seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Servant Summer Camp!]] event as an Archer-class NPC. A Chinese alchemist, sorcerer, and explorer who lived from 255 BC to approximately 195-155 BC. [[Shi Huang Di (fate)|]] sent Xu Fu on two separate journeys to find the elixir of immortality.

In Fate, Xu Fu is a woman who was [[yandere|obsessed]] with [[Yu Mei-ren (fate)|]], wanting to also find a way to kill immortals in order to relieve her of her endless life. She is always seen carrying around a [[character doll]] of her.

She appeared in [[Battle in New York 2022]] as [[Odysseus (fate)|Space Odysseus]]'s assistant, [[Space Xu Fu (fate)|]]. She also appears in [[Traum (fate/grand order)|]] as a Caster-class servant of the Righteous Realm, and was introduced as a playable Alter Ego-class servant during the 7th anniversary.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Endo (takolegs)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Misaki Watada]]

title: yoo_jin-ho
body: A supporting character from the South Korean multimedia franchise [[Solo Leveling]]. After main character [[Sung Jin-Woo]] saved him from criminal hunters, he became very devoted to him, started to call him "hyung-nim" (Korean for "elder brother [of a male sibling]", which is used as honorific to show respect to any elder male, even if he's not a blood-related brother) and became the vice-guild master of the guild Jin-Woo founded.

body: A character from the South Korean multimedia franchise [[Solo Leveling]]. He's an American hunter and one of the most powerful in the world, above even [i]regular[/i] S-rank hunters (one of the "National Level Hunters").

title: minamoto_no_tametomo_(fate)
body:
Archer-class Servant introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Traum (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt. Tametomo is known as a powerful archer from the Hougen Rebellion of 1156, and it is said that he once sunk an entire Taira ship with a single arrow by puncturing its hull below the waterline. In Fate, he appears as an autonomous [[robot]] with [[full armor|full]] [[Japanese armor]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Dd (vktr4837)|]]

title: kaioura
body:
An English [[indie virtual YouTuber|indie]] [[virtual YouTuber]]. Her current model was made by [[yuniiho]], her former model by Indonesian artist Cuwiie, with a chibi model designed by [[minaowa_(artist)|Minaowa]].

She is a [[fox girl]] with [[purple hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[lily (flower)|lily]] [[hair flower]], and a lavender/[[purple kimono]] or alternatively a [[frills|frilled]] [[purple shirt|purple]] [[off-shoulder shirt]] with [[detached sleeves]] and a [[black skirt]]. She is fond of [[watermelon]] which can often be seen near her.

h4. External Links
* Twitch: "kaioura":[https://www.twitch.tv/kaioura]
* Twitter: "@kaiourachu":[https://mobile.twitter.com/kaiourachu]

title: ryuushen_(3rd_costume)
body:
The third [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Ryuushen]]. This is their current default costume from April 2019 onward. 

The costume consists of a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[black shirt|black]] [[crop top]], a [[brown choker]], [[black bridal gauntlets|black]] [[bridal gauntlets]], a [[white jacket]] (usually worn [[off shoulder]]) with sleeves going [[sleeves past fingers|past their fingertips]], a large [[grey loincloth|grey]] [[print loincloth|print]] [[loincloth]] worn over [[black pants]], and [[black shoes|black]] [[flats]] with [[no socks]]. They have [[multiple piercings]] on both ears, including a [[tassel earrings|tassel earring]], and there is an option for [[round eyewear|round]] [[glasses]] with a [[eyewear strap|strap]]. Ryuushen holds a [[stuffed panda]] with this costume.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8111509: Profile (off-shoulder jacket)
* !asset #25720385: Profile (no jacket)
* !asset #25720386: Profile (jacket done up, with glasses)

body:
The 9th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Takanashi Kiara]], first appeared in her original song [[PERFUME (takanashi kiara)|]]. Costume designed by [[takanashi kiara (artist)|herself]]. 

It consists of a [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[pink dress]] with [[white frills]], [[pink sleeves|matching]] [[detached sleeves]], [[white socks|white]] [[kneehighs]] and [[pink shoes|pink]] [[platform heels]]. Her [[official alternate hairstyle|hair in this outfit]] is worn [[straight hair|straight]] with bangs [[swept bangs|swept to the right]], and her [[feather earrings]] are colored pink to match the rest of the costume.

title: itsuka_shidou
body:
The protagonist of the [[Date a Live]] story. He possesses a strange power that allows him to seal the powers of a Spirit in his body with a kiss.

During the events of Miku Lily, Shido had to crossdress as a girl to interact with Miku, thereby disguising himself as his alternate identity, [[Itsuka Shiori]].

[spoiler]It is later revealed that Shido was originally [[Takamiya Shinji]].[/spoiler]

title: satono_crown_(racehorse)
body:
Japanese [[horse|racehorse]] (conceived in Ireland?). Sired by Marju (his last crop) and foaled by Jioconda. He is the winner of the 2016 Hong Kong Vase and the 2017 Takarazuka Kinen.

He is a dark bay horse with a small, peculiarly-shaped star marking (the "crown") and no leg markings.

As a sire, he currently has a single graded winner with [[Tastiera (racehorse)|]].

title: fire_escape
body:
A fire escape is a kind of emergency exit that is usually mounted to the outside of a building— They may be inside but in an area separated from the main building. They consist of a number of horizontal platforms, one at each story of a building, with [[stairs]] or [[ladder|ladders]] connecting them. The platforms and stairs are usually made of open metal gratings in order to prevent the build-up of ice, leaves, and snow— They may be made of [[concrete]] instead, especially if they are indoors.

They provide a method of evacuation in the event of a fire or other emergency that would make the stairwells inside the building inaccessible. They are most commonly found on multi-story residential buildings.

title: neck_brace
body: A cervical spine brace protects the bone in the neck after damage has occured. The soft type looks like a bulky cloth collar and is designed to provide support after an injury. The more recognizable rigid type is larger and is made with molded plastic to restrict neck movement during recovery from a fracture or surgery. Modified versions of the rigid-type brace are worn by athletes who participate in high-impact sports and auto racing to prevent injuries.

title: fusebox
body: A fusebox, fuse box, or circuit breaker box is a metal box that contains the electrical fuses for the electrical system in a building. They are typically located in storage rooms, basements, hallways or on an outside wall of the building, depending on the building's age.

title: wekapipo
body:
Wekapipo is a [spoilers]secondary antagonist, and later a secondary ally[/spoilers], featured in the seventh part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[Steel Ball Run]].
Wekapipo is most notable for his bizarre haircut, which consists of a series of shaved grid lines and squares of [[short hair]] and [[beard]]. He enters the story sporting a [[mustache]], which he later shaves off. He is often shown wearing a light-colored jacket with [[high collar]] and [[necktie]], and pants covered with paired overlapping polka dots. He sports pants of the same design.

He using [[steel ball (jojo)|steel balls]] in fights.

title: a-10_thunderbolt_ii
body:
The [b]A-10 Thunderbolt II[/b] is a straight-winged twin-tailed subsonic [[jet]] that entered service with the US Air Force in 1977. It is powered by two turbofans mounted in pods above the fuselage. Designed exclusively for close air support, the single-pilot Warthog can carry copious amounts of bombs, rockets, and missiles, but its best-known features are its [[GAU-8]] Avenger cannon and its ability to tolerate battle damage and remain operational.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* Wikipedia: "Fairchild Republic A-10":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fairchild_Republic_A-10_Thunderbolt_II
* [[Area 88]]

title: f-20_tigershark
body:
An advanced development of the Northrop [[F-5 Freedom Fighter]] Tiger II [[jet]] fighter that began in 1975 and first flew in 1982. The [b]Northrop F-20 "Tigershark"[/b] had small leading edge root extensions, a flattened nose, and a single F404 "turbofan":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turbofan. 

Despite proving to be a very capable multirole light combat aircraft during trials, only a few prototypes were developed and the jet was never mass produced. The project was finally cancelled in 1986.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Northrop F-20 Tigershark":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northrop_F-20_Tigershark

body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. The [[Cooking Oil (nikke)|]] squad consists of her and [[Crust (nikke)|]].

title: hey_arnold!
body: Hey Arnold! is an American animated sitcom created by Craig Bartlett for [[Nickelodeon]]. It originally aired from October 7, 1996, to June 8, 2004. The show centers on fourth grader [[Arnold Shortman]], who lives with his grandparents in an inner-city tenement in the fictional city of Hillwood. Episodes center on his experiences navigating urban life while dealing with the zany hijinks he and his friends encounter. Many episodes, however, focus on other characters, including major, secondary, supporting, and even minor characters.

title: list_of_fate_series_characters
body:
This is a compilation of all tagged characters, weapons, and other miscellaneous terms seen in the [[fate (series)|Fate series]], a mixed-media project developed by Type-Moon. All tags will be listed in the first entry they appear in to avoid redundancy. Servants will also have any related weapons, alternate forms, and/or Noble Phantasms (essentially a powerful attack the Servant can use) listed beneath that Servant's name.

title: jack_the_ripper_(fate/apocrypha)
body:
The Assassin of "Black" servant of [[Rikudou Reika]] in [[Fate/Apocrypha]]. Appears as an Assassin servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]], debuting in the [[London (fate/grand order)|]] singularity.

Often paired with other child servants, like [[Nursery Rhyme (fate)|]], [[Jeanne d'Arc Alter Santa Lily (fate)|]], and [[Paul Bunyan (fate)|]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Sanada Taketo]]
[b]Illustrator:[/b] [[Konoe Ototsugu]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Tange Sakura]]

title: fate/strange_fake
body:
A light novel and manga series set in the [[Fate (series)|Fate universe]], written by [[Narita Ryohgo (mangaka)|]] and illustrated by [[Morii Shizuki]].

Originally an approved [[Fate/stay night]] fanfiction intended to be the introduction for a role playing style game by [[Narita Ryohgo (mangaka)|]]. Initially released as ''Fake/states night'' for a Type-MOON [[April Fools]] Day joke, then later rereleased in the form of a novel included as an extra with the magazine Type-MOON Ace 2. Eventually got an official light novel series and manga adaptation.

The plot centers around a Grail War faultily copied from the Third Holy Grail War in Fuyuki. The story is set in Snowfield, a fictional city in the United States located just outside of Las Vegas.

h4. Characters

h6. False Servants

* [[No Name Assassin (fate)|]] (False Assassin; Master: [[Jester Karture]])
* [[Jack the Ripper (fate/strange fake)|]] (False Berserker; Master: [[Flat Escardos]])
* [[Alexandre Dumas (fate)|]] (False Caster; Master: [[Orlando Reeve]])
* [[Enkidu (fate)|]] (False Lancer; Master: [[Wolf (fate)|]])
* [[Gilgamesh (fate)|]] (False Archer; Master: [[Tine Chelc]])
* [[Pale Rider (fate)|]] (False Rider; Master: [[Kuruoka Tsubaki]])

h6. True Servants

* [[Alcides (fate)|]] (True Archer; Master: [[Bazdilot Cordelion]])
* [[Richard I (fate)|]] (True Saber; Master: [[Sajou Ayaka (fate/strange fake)|]])
* [[Hippolyta (fate)|]] (True Rider; Master: Doris Lusendra)
* [[True Assassin (fate/strange fake)|]] (Master: [[Faldeus Dioland]])
* [[Francois Prelati (fate)|]] (True Caster; Master: [[Francesca Prelati (fate)|]])
* [[Huwawa (fate)|]] (True Berserker; Master: [[Haruri Borzak]])
* [[Watcher (fate)|]] (Master: [[Sigma (fate)|]])

title: bakugou_katsuki
body:
Deuteragonist of [[Boku no Hero Academia]], and [[Midoriya Izuku]]'s rival since childhood. His Quirk allows him to produce explosions from the sweat on his hands. Bakugou is very aggressive and short-tempered, often yelling at others or threatening to kill them. He has a superiority complex and hates being looked down on.

Bakugou has [[spiked hair|spiked]] [[blonde hair]] and [[red eyes]]. He is the only student in Class 1A who does not wear a tie with his [[school uniform]].

title: flat_escardos
body:
[[Fate/strange Fake]] character. The Master of [[Jack the Ripper (fate/strange fake)|]] (False Berserker).

He is one of the students under tutor of [[Lord El-Melloi II]]. A talented magus with a personality that is best described as "carefree", "naive", and "good-hearted", he joined Snowfield Holy Grail War to befriend humans and servants alike.

h4. See also

* [[List of Fate series characters]]

h4. External links

* "Type-Moon Wiki: Flat Escardos":[https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Flat_Escardos]

title: bakugou_mitsuki
body:
Character in [[Boku no Hero Academia]]. Mother of [[Bakugou Katsuki]] and wife to [[Bakugou Masaru]].

Her Quirk, [i]Glycerin[/i], allows her to secrete a smooth liquid from her skin. This would combine with Masaru's [i]Oxidizing Sweat[/i], which gives his sweat the same properties as nitric acid, into their son Katsuki's signature [i]Explosion[/i] Quirk. Furthermore, she has passed on her [[blonde hair]] and short fuse to her son, as Mitsuki is demonstrated to be similarly temperamental.

title: traum_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Realm of the Thanatos Impulse, Traum[/b]
[quote]
Having conquered the British Lostbelt and the NFF HQ, Chaldea detects a massive Singularity with an immeasurable Humanity Foundation Value. It is a world split into three realms—each with its own king—where Servants are ceaselessly summoned to battle each other.

Chaldea's Master is overwhelmed by the unthinkable sight of armies of Servants clashing ceaselessly. As if to make things worse, an unseen hand slowly but surely reaches out for Master.

"Who could have done this, and why? Most importantly, how did they summon so many Servants?"

This is not a typical mission into a Singularity. Who could this Master be? Some mysteries may be better left unsolved...
[/quote]

A singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in North America and occurring before the events of [[Nahui Mictlan (fate/grand order)|]]. [spoiler]It is maintained by [[Specimen E]] in order to enact revenge on the Human Order.[/spoiler] It was released on the Japanese server on June 1, 2022, and on the NA server on May 13, 2024.

title: atlantis_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Lostbelt No. 5: Ancient Ocean of the Dreadnought Gods, Atlantis[/b]
[quote]
Kirschtaria, the leader of the Crypters, controls a Lostbelt rich in giant relics left by the gods.
Its residents are strong, godsfearing people who stand firm even in the face of the Demonic Beasts which threaten the region.
It is a place dominated by a civilization that once stood at the height of supremacy, but is now little more than a shadow of its former glory.
All that remains finds itself adrift in a vast ocean.
That ocean's name: Atlantis. This world, in Proper Human History, is said to be one of the lost ancient civilizations.

A grueling conflict where both sides leave nothing in reserve ensues in the fifth and largest Lostbelt yet. It is said that this day will see a god brought down...
But will that foretelling bear fruit or wither on the vine?
[/quote]
The first part of the fifth Lostbelt in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in the Atlantic Ocean and supervised by the Crypter [[Kirschtaria Wodime]]. The second part of the Lostbelt is covered during the [[Olympus (fate/grand order)|]] chapter. Released on the Japanese server on December 18, 2019 and on the NA server on December 1, 2021.

title: don_quixote_(fate)
body:
Lancer-class servant from [[Fate/Grand Order]] introduced in the [[Traum (fate/grand order)|]] chapter. The [[alonso quixano|eponymous protagonist]] from the [[don quixote (novel)|Spanish novel of the same name]].

A day-dreaming and lowly noble who underwent adventures to revive chivalry and serve his country. He is accompanied by [[Sancho Panza (fate)|]], his squire and partner. In contrast to other servants, as his ascension level increases his [[armor]] gets dingier.

[spoiler]He was initially summoned to the [[Atlantis (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt, but fled after watching other servants be defeated. He and Sancho arrived in the Traum singularity, where he posed as [[Karl der Grosse (fate)|]] and led the Righteous Realm.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Murayama Ryota]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Tobita Nobuo]]

title: dark_souls_iii
body:
[i][b]Dark Souls III[/b][/i] is a 2016 fantasy action RPG developed for Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One by From Software. It is the final entry in the [i][[Dark Souls (series)|Dark Souls]][/i] trilogy. The first DLC is called [b]Ashes of Ariandel[/b] and the second one [b]The Ringed City[/b].

title: sancho_panza_(fate)
body:
A woman who accompanies [[Don Quixote (fate)|]] when he is summoned as a servant. She shares her name with the squire [[Sancho Panza]] from [[Don Quixote (novel)|]], but also incorporates elements of other characters, such as his horse [[Rocinante]], the prankster Altisidora, and his imaginary princess [[Dulcinea del Toboso]].

She appears as a [[horse girl]] who, depending on the ascension level, is either dressed as a [[maid]] or a [[princess]]. Her primary goal is to keep Quixote out of harm. [spoiler]She was the one who helped Quixote flee from the [[Atlantis (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt, and orchestrated his disguise as [[Karl der Grosse (fate)|]] in the [[Traum (fate/grand order)|]] singularity.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Murayama Ryota]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Arai Satomi]]

title: bhima_(fate)
body:
Lancer-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]], first briefly appearing in the [[Johanna-san to Mikakunin no Ai]] event before being featured in the [[Paper Moon (fate/grand order)|]] chapter. He was also used as the representative servant of the chapter in promotional material for Ordeal Call. He is the half-brother of [[Arjuna (fate)|]] and is one of the Five Princes, with [[Karna (fate)|]] also being one of his half-brothers. Defeated and killed [[Duryodhana (fate)|]] in a duel.

title: jack_the_ripper_(fate/strange_fake)
body:
[[Fate/strange Fake]] character. The "False" Berserker-class Servant of [[Flat Escardos]].

[b]True Name:[/b] Unknown. He is the embodiment of the legend of Jack the Ripper, but as the killer's true identity remains unknown, he has no knowledge of the actual person behind the legend.

title: satake_mei
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i].

* !post #6651233

A Tracen representative in France, Satake Mei is the host for the Project L'Arc scenario, being your guide for the races in Longchamps.

A small tomboyish girl with a sisterly relationship with [[Akikawa Yayoi (umamusume)|]], she has [[short hair|short]] [[light brown hair|chestnut brown hair]], [[brown eyes]] and constantly wears a yellow [[baseball cap]] with the Tracen logo. She wears an outfit consisting of [[short shorts|short]] [[brown shorts]], a white t-shirt under a torn black shirt, a yellow and brown hooded jacket and a backpack.

Her unique effect of her SSR card is the ability to appear at two training facilities at once, leading to jokes about being able to duplicate herself.

[spoiler]She is implied to not only be a secret [[horse girl]], she's implied to be [[Dictus (racehorse)|]], as her relationship to Akikawa Yayoi (who is herself implied to be Northern Taste), her familiarity to races in France (Dictus is French) and her birthday (April 11) matches. Thus she is often drawn alongside [[Ikuno Dictus (umamusume)|]] and [[Dictus Striker (umamusume)|]] ([i][[umamusume:_cinderella_gray|Cinderella Gray]][/i]'s iteration of [[Soccer Boy (racehorse)|]]). Her baseball cap does feature three badges with the racing colors of Dictus' best progeny (The two above and Movie Star) on the [b]right side[/b] of the hat.[/spoiler]

title: caren_hortensia
body:
Caren Hortensia is a character from [i][[Fate/hollow ataraxia]][/i], the daughter of [[Kotomine Kirei]] and [[Claudia Hortensia]].

She has light [[grey hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. 
Usually seen wearing a church [[robe]], and a [[hat]] if she is outdoors. On the other hand, Caren also wears what she calls her 'exorcist uniform' which is composed of a [[dress]], [[pantyhose]], and [[thighhighs]] but without a skirt.

She is introduced as [[caren hortensia (amor caren)|Amor Caren]], a playable Ruler-class Servant, in the 2021 Valentine event of [[Fate/Grand Order]].

title: noble_phantasm_(fate)
body:
In the [[Fate (series)|Fate series]], a Noble Phantasm is a Servant's ultimate ability, representing an aspect of their history/mythology/fiction that makes them famous. It can be either a weapon or a supportive item. While Noble Phantasms have powerful offensive, defensive, or supportive capabilities, it comes with the downside of revealing a Servant's identity to their opponents, thus exposing their potential weaknesses. 

This tag refers to when a character is releasing their Noble Phantasm in an image.

title: caren_hortensia_(calling_agape)
body: [[caren hortensia (amor caren)|Amor Caren]] in her outfit that she wears during her Noble Phantasm, [b]The Greatest Hits - "Calling Agape"[/b]. She wears a golden hairband with hearts, a long white dress, and a blue sash. She also has a pair of huge golden wings.

title: james_moriarty_(ruler)_(fate)
body:
A younger version of [[James Moriarty (Archer) (fate)|James Moriarty Archer]] introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Traum (fate/grand order)|]] chapter. [spoiler]He is one of the [[Foreign Disciples (fate/grand order)|]], tasked with killing [[Sherlock Holmes (fate)|]].[/spoiler] He uses an [[oversized object|oversized]] [[compass (instrument)|]] as a [[staff]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Honjou Raita]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Itou Kent]]

title: james_moriarty_(archer)_(fate)
body:
Archer-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[Shinjuku (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity under the alias [b]Archer of Shinjuku[/b]. The infamous rival of [[Sherlock Holmes (fate)|]]. A sharp-dressed man wielding a cane and a [[nicholas d. wolfwood|Nicholas Wolfwood]]-esque casket containing a variety of ranged weapons, his Noble Phantasm is "The Ultimate Crime". 

[b]Character Design[/b]: [[Honjou Raita]]
[b]Voice Actor[/b]: [[Hashi Takaya]]

title: cu_chulainn_(caster)_(fate)
body:
A member of the Caster class in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The same hero as [[Cu Chulainn (fate/stay night)|]] from [[Fate/Stay Night]].

[spoiler]He reappears in the Britain Lostbelt, calling himself Grimnir ("Hooded One") which is one of Odin's many aliases.[/spoiler]

title: symbol-shaped_pupils
body:
For posts where a character has some sort of symbol or item as their pupils as opposed to regular pupils. Note that this tag is not for when the eyes are replaced completely with symbols.

If the character has writing instead of symbols in their eyes, use [[text in eyes]] tag.

Not to be confused with [[symbol in eye]].

h4. Examples
* !post #6652109: [[Cross-shaped pupils]]
* !post #8534405: [[Diamond-shaped pupils]]

title: diarmuid_ua_duibhne_(fate)
body:
Servant appearing in [[Fate/Zero]] and [[Fate/Grand Order]]. He is summonable in to two different classes, Lancer and Saber.

Based on "the character from the Ulster cycle":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diarmuid_Ua_Duibhne, he was a knight who possessed a [[mole|beauty mark]] which could enchant women, resulting in [[Fionn mac Cumhaill (fate/grand order)|]]'s betrothed [[Grainne (fate)|]] asking to elope with him. This story would later become the basis for the story of [[Lancelot (fate/zero)|]] and [[Guinevere (fate)|]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]] ([[Fate/Zero]]), [[azuazuazu19]] ([[Fate/Grand Order]]), [[Azusa (hws)|]] (Saber)
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Midorikawa Hikaru]]

title: medea_lily_(fate)
body:
[[Medea (caster) (fate)|Medea]] of [[Fate/Stay Night]] as a [[Magical Girl]], similar to that of [[Saber Lily]].

Like the regular Caster, she has [[pointy ears]], [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]], but she has her hair in a [[ponytail]] and wears a [[strapless dress]], a [[see-through capelet|see-through]] [[capelet]], [[mismatched gloves]] and [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] [[thigh boots]].

Playable in [[Fate/Grand Order]] as a [[aged down]] version of Caster herself, and also appears in [[Jason (fate)|]]'s attack animations.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Koyama Hirokazu]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Nonaka Ai]]

title: mahou_shoujo_kikou_~prisma_codes~
body:
[b]The Abandoned Fantasy: End Sacrifice[br]Magical Girl Cruise ~Prisma Codes~[/b]
[quote]You awaken amidst unfamiliar scenery.

It's a land of enchantment, ruled by magical girls!
A chance encounter with a suspicious magic wand leads you to a certain young lady.
Utterly lost in this mysterious world, you set off together to search for her missing friend—[/quote]
A collaboration event in [[Fate/Grand Order]] with [[Fate/kaleid liner PRISMA ILLYA]], released on the Japanese server on September 8, 2016 and on the NA server on August 23, 2018. [[Chloe von Einzbern (Archer Install)|]] is given as a reward to players for completing the event.

title: jason_(fate)
body:
Character appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. He first appeared as an NPC during the [[Okeanos (fate/grand order)|]] before being released as a Saber-class Servant during the 5th anniversary. A Greek mythological hero who was the leader of the [[Argonauts (fate)|]], and was married to [[Medea (fate)|]].

It should be noted that Fate's version of Jason is particularly abusive and cowardly, especially towards Medea, though he considers [[Heracles (fate)|]] as his best friend. In combat, he directs [[Medea lily (fate)|]], [[Atalanta (fate)|]], and [[Heracles (fate)|]] to attack for him on his behalf.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[BLACK (artist)|]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Hoshi Souichirou]]

title: solomon_(singularity)_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Final Singularity: The Grand Temple of Time, Solomon[/b]
[quote]
With the seven Singularities repaired, the final battleground awaits in a Singularity that exists outside human history.
Your foes: the 72 Demon Gods who protect the throne of the Mage King Solomon.
The ultimate battle for humanity's future is about to begin!
[/quote]
The final singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Set in the year 2016 in [[Grand Caster (fate)|Solomon]]'s [[Ars Paulina (fate)|temple]], it serves as a grand finale to the first arc, with the [[absolutely everyone|majority of servants]] joining in the fight.

Released on the Japanese server on December 22, 2016 and on the NA server on December 20, 2018. It was adapted into a movie by [[Cloverworks]], [i]Fate/Grand Order: Final Singularity - The Grand Temple of Time: Solomon[/i].

title: heian-kyou_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Naraka Mandala, Heian-kyou[/b]
[quote]
The members of Chaldea return from their brutal struggle in the Fifth Lostbelt. As they prepare to begin their mission in the next Lostbelt, they detect a new Singularity, which is marked as a sign of Humanity's collapse. Until now, it had been believed that no such signs could be seen upon the bleached earth, where human history has come to an end.

It is in the Heian period in Japan. The splendid capital Heian-kyou enjoys tremendous prosperity under the enduring rule of the Fujiwara clan.

But after Rayshifting to what should be a time of plenty, Chaldea instead finds a world overrun by evil spirits and infested by horrid abominations. In this land, "Imperial Warriors" conduct a ritual modeled after a Holy Grail War.

Who are the Imperial Warriors, and what purpose does their ritual serve? In this mysterious, millennium-old city, Chaldea's Master faces the machinations of the Beautiful Carnivore.
[/quote]
A singularity that formed on the bleached earth in [[Fate/Grand Order]], created and maintained by [[Ashiya Douman (fate)|]] where he attempts to transition it into its own Lostbelt. It's set in Japan in A.D. 1008 and takes place following the events of [[Olympus (fate/grand order)|]]. Released on the Japanese server December 4, 2020 and on the NA server on November 21, 2022.

title: argonauts_(fate)
body:
A post that features [b]four or more[/b] of the Argonauts from [[Fate (series)|]]. This includes the original Argonauts from [[Greek mythology]] and the Neo-Argonauts seen in the [[Atlantis (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt.

See {{argonauts_(fate) -atlantis_(fate/grand_order)}} for posts focusing on the historical Argonauts and {{argonauts_(fate) atlantis_(fate/grand_order)}} for posts focusing on the Neo-Argonauts.

The original Argonauts include:

* [[Jason (fate)|]] 
* [[Heracles (fate)|]]
* [[Medea (caster) (fate)|]]/[[Medea lily (fate)|Medea Lily]]
* [[Atalanta (fate)|]]
* [[Asclepius (fate)|]]
* [[Theseus (fate)|]]
* [[Castor (fate)|]]
* [[Pollux (fate)|]] 
* [[Caenis (fate)|]]
* [[Peleus (fate)|]]

The Neo-Argonauts are comprised of:

* [[Jason (fate)|]]
* [[Achilles (fate)|]]
* [[Bartholomew Roberts (fate)|]]
* [[Charlotte Corday (fate)|]]
* [[Mandricardo (fate)|]]
* [[Super Orion (fate)|]]
* [[Paris (fate)|]]
* [[Mochizuki Chiyome (fate)|]]

While not historically Argonauts, Jason [[gameplay mechanics|can buff]] the "Argo-related" Greek servants [[Chiron (fate)|]], [[Circe (fate)|]], and [[Nemo (fate)|Triton]].

title: okeanos_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Third Singularity: Sealed Ends of the Four Seas, Okeanos[/b]
[quote]
The third Grand Order is set in 1573.
This is the Age of Exploration where many pirates give their lives for endless treasures.
In this sealed sea, Okeanos, due to the Incineration of Humanity, legendary pirates will risk everything for the greatest treasure, the Holy Grail.
[/quote]
The third singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. It's set in the year 1573 in an endless ocean, after [[Francis Drake (fate)|]] went on a voyage and encountered [[Poseidon (mythology)|]] in Atlantis, where she defeated him and acquired his [[holy grail (fate)|]]. Due to another holy grail being inserted in the era as part of the plot to incinerate humanity, the energy of the two competed together resulting in the endless ocean.

Released on the Japanese server on November 5, 2015 and on the NA server on September 28, 2017.

h4. Characters

title: saber_wars
body:
[b]SABER WARS ~The Caliburn Awakens~[br]Lily's Cosmic Winter Rebellion[/b]
[quote]It is a period of Holy Grail War. CHALDEA enjoys an uneasy moment of peace as the struggle for humanity's future continues. Seeking the elusive ARTORIUM, a mysterious alien has appeared from the sky, but her true motives remain hidden. Saber Lily, the youngest fighter of the Unenhanced NP Alliance, sets out on a journey that will shape her destiny...
[/quote]
A limited time event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on January 20, 2016 and on the NA server on January 4, 2018. It introduces the concept of the Servant Universe and heavily parodies [[Star Wars]]. [[Saber Lily]] (originally only available as pre-registration bonus) is given to players as a reward for completing the event.

title: kara_no_kyoukai/the_garden_of_order
body:
[b]Spiral Boundary, Ogawa-heim[br][b]the Garden of sinners/the Garden of Order[/b]
[quote]A ripple has appeared on the island nation where Singularity F was observed.
It draws Servants in, inescapable, inexorable.
At the end of the Rayshift stands the girl with Mystic Eyes of Death Perception.
But even with her help, uncovering the truth will not be easy...
[/quote]
A collaboration event in [[Fate/Grand Order]] with [[Kara no Kyoukai]], released on the Japanese server on February 25, 2016 and on the NA server on February 8, 2018. [[Ryougi Shiki|Ryougi Shiki (Assassin)]] is given to players as a reward for completing the event.

h4. Characters
* [[Void Shiki]]
* [[Romani Archaman]]
* [[Mash Kyrielight]]

* [[Edmond Dantes (fate)|???]]
[[Kokutou Azaka]], [[Illyasviel von Einzbern]], [[Medea lily (fate)|]], [[Aozaki Touko]], [[Diarmuid Ua Duibhne (Lancer) (fate)|]], and [[Saber (fate)|]] appear in the "promotional video":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=92YMDisG1OU], but not the event story.

title: lily_servant
body:
Theoretical fan-designed [[light persona]] and often [[aged down]] version of a character from the [[fate (series)|Fate series]]. Although the tag is [i]Lily Servant[/i], this can apply to Masters and other human characters as well. Lily Servants are depicted as more benevolent versions of their original selves, and tend to wear white clothing.

The opposite of this is [[Alter Servant]].

Not to be used for official Lily Servants or official aged-down variants of servants, which include:

* [[Medea lily (fate)|]]
* [[Medusa (Lancer) (fate)|]]
* [[Leonardo da Vinci (Rider) (fate)|]]
* [[Jeanne d'Arc Alter Santa Lily (fate)|]] (also counts as an [[Alter Servant]])
* [[Saber Lily]]
* [[Sessyoin Kiara (Lily)]]
* [[Ushi Gozen (fate)|]]
* [[Christopher-kun (fate)|]]
* [[Child Gilgamesh (fate)|]]
* [[Alexander (fate)|]]
* [[Fergus mac Roich (Young) (fate)|]]
* [[Setanta (fate)|]]

h4. See Also
* [[Santa Lily]]

title: li_shuwen_(old)_(fate)
body:
The older version of [[Li Shuwen (fate)|]]. In [[Koha-Ace]], he is a Lancer-class Servant summoned by [[Caren Hortensia|Kotomine Caren]]. In [[Fate/type redline]], he is instead summoned by [[Lanlan Fang]]. In [[Fate/Grand Order]], he appears as an Assassin-class Servant in the [[S I N (fate/grand order)|Chinese Lostbelt]]. He appears as the Rogue Assassin in the Waxing Moon Ritual of [[Fate/Samurai Remnant]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]], [[Wada Arco]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Kunihiko Yasui]]

title: list_of_fate_series_alternate_costumes
body:
This list is a compilation of all the [i]named[/i] alternate costumes seen throughout the entire [[fate (series)|Fate series]].

The franchise releases these costumes through many different methods:

* Official artbooks
* Anniversary illustrations
* Figurines
* Anime episodes
* Downloadable content (DLC)
* [[craft essence (fate)|Craft Essences]] (an illustration that provide special effects for characters in [[Fate/Grand Order]])
* Spiritron Costumes (alternate skins for playable characters in FGO)
* Mystic Codes (similar to Spiritron Costumes, but for the main protagonist)

If a costume does not have a name attributed to it, look for it under the [[official alternate costume]] tag along with a character search.

h4.Uncategorized
* [[Arts shirt]]
* [[Buster shirt]]
* [[Extra Attack shirt]]
* [[Quick shirt]]

title: artoria_pendragon_(lancer_alter)_(fate)
body:
[[Saber (fate)| Artoria Pendragon]] in [[Dark Persona|Alter state]] as a Lancer-class Servant, first debuted in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[London (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity. She uses King Arthur's spear [[Rhongomyniad (fate)|]] instead of [[Excalibur (fate/stay night)|]].

Being based on [[Artoria Pendragon (Lancer) (Fate)|the hypothetical version of]] Artoria who did not possesses the age-halting [[Caliburn (fate)|]] and [[avalon (fate)|Avalon]]. This version of Artoria is [[large breasts|much more developed]] than normal. Battles while mounted on a horse named [[llamrei (fate)|Llamrei]]. Her actions as the Storm King allowed her to head the Wild Hunt after her passing.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Ishida Akira]]

title: artoria_pendragon_(fate)
body:
[b]Altria Pendragon[/b] (also known by the popular fan romanization as [b]Artoria Pendragon[/b]) is a character from the [[Fate (series)|]] series, and the [i]de facto[/i] mascot of the series.

She is a [[genderswap (mtf)|]]ped version of [[King Arthur (mythology)|]] from the old English mythology, manifested as a "Servant", powerful manifestation of historical/mythological figures in the Fate universe.

She and her variants, with the exception of Arthur Pendragon, are voiced by [[Kawasumi Ayako]].

She first appeared in [[Fate/stay night]] as [[Saber (fate)|]], but later went on to appear in many other forms throughout the [[Fate (series)|]] series. This tag is an umbrella tag that collects all versions of Artoria Pendragon under one tag.

title: elizabeth_bathory_(fate)
body:
Lancer-class servant from the [[Fate (series)|Fate]] series. The (younger) depiction of the Hungarian "blood countess" of the same name.

Appears as a small girl with [[long_hair|long]] [[pink hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She has [[uneven horns]], a [[dragon_tail|tail]], [[pointy ears]], and pink nails that take up the entirety of her actual fingers. She wears a dress and high heel boots with a single spike protruding from each one which all have a diamond theme.

In [[rojiura satsuki: chapter heroine sanctuary|Rojiura Sanctuary]], she wears an [[idol]] costume with a black [[corset]] and a [[plaid skirt|plaid white-and-black skirt]] (treated as her Second Ascension outfit in [[Fate/Grand Order]]).

[b]True Name:[/b] Elizabeth Báthory
[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]], [[Wada Arco]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Ookubo Rumi]]

title: artoria_pendragon_(lancer)_(fate)
body:
A version of [[Saber (fate)|]] summoned as a Lancer-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She wields [[Rhongomyniad (fate)|Rhongomyniad]] instead of [[Excalibur (fate/stay night)|Excalibur]].

This version of Artoria is taller, possesses [[large breasts|larger breasts]], longer bangs ([[swept bangs|swept]] or [[hair between eyes|falling between her eyes]]), and longer [[sidelocks]]. Due to her larger breasts, she's often called 乳王 (Milk/Breast King) among the fanbase.

The reason for her more endowed appearance is because [spoilers]she's not affected by Excalibur's side effects that prevent its user from aging further.[/spoilers]

Her horse is named [[Dun Stallion (fate)|]]. And her breastplate is most likely modeled after a tournament (jousting) helmet called a "[i]Frog-mouth helm[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frog-mouth_helm, "[i]Stechhelm[/i]":https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stechhelm or "[i]Krötenkopfhelm[/i]":https://mittelalter.fandom.com/de/wiki/Krötenkopfhelm.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Ishida Akira]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kawasumi Ayako]]
