title: gyro_zeppeli
body:
[spoilers] Real name is Julius Caesar Zeppeli.[/spoilers] One of the main protagonists of [[Steel Ball Run]], alongside [[Johnny Joestar]]. A competitor in the Steel Ball Run race, he possesses control over a mysterious ability known as the [i]Spin[/i]. Bearing similarities to the [i]Hamon[/i] martial art from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Parts 1 and 2, it allows Gyro to imbue a powerful rotational force on the pair of steel balls he uses as weapons.

Distinctive traits include his [[long hair]], a wide-brimmed [[hat]] with long slits in it, teeth reading "GO!GO! ZEPPELI", and a [[beard]] made from square patches of hair. He's wearing shirt with [[high collar]] and [[short sleeves]], light [[cape]], a light belt with a harness depicting hands [[pointing]] at groin area, 3 rings on forearms and [[bridal gauntlets]] and pants fused with boots with [[spurs]].

In anime he wear changed final costume. It's long [[blonde hair]] male with [[green lips]] and [[blue eyes]] a wide-brimmed [[cowboy hat]] and grey [[goggles on headwear]] (in different from manga, on them just 2 lines on place of 3) with long slits in it, [[gold teeth|golden teeth]] reading "GO!GO! ZEPPELI", and a [[beard]] made from square patches of hair. He wear [[high collar|high collared]] [[purple shirt]] with short [[two-tone sleeves]] that colored in purple and orange, [[blue bridal gauntlets]], [[orange belt]] with a blue harness depicting hands [[pointing]] at groin area, [[brown pants]] fused with boots and [[spurs]] on them, two [[holster]] for green [[steel ball (jojo)|]], [[green cape]], in different with manga, he doesn't have 3 rings on his forearm, but only 1, and instead of a lot of rivets on shirt, he has a small number of them in x-cross shape on shirt.

[spoilers]He's became a [[Stand (jojo)|]] user with [[Stand (jojo)|]] [[Ball Breaker (stand)|]], when he using golden spin.[/spoilers]
other_names: ユーリウス・カイザー・ツェペリ

title: kemonomimi_mode
body:
When characters who don't normally have any animal-like features (such as ears or a tail) are depicted with animal ears, tail, and/or a [i]little[/i] fur.

This can also include characters who are canonically animal-like, but are depicted with a different set of animal features (post #640641, for example).

Note, however, that this does [b]not[/b] include characters who can modally become animal-like, such as [[Inu Sakuya (nejikirio)|]] or the [[Strike Witches]].

Also not to be confused with [[fake animal ears]].

When there are more animal-like features like a [[snout]] or full fur use [[furrification]] instead.

title: kaere!_ootsurudani_kitaku_club
body:
“Kaere! Ootsurudani Kitaku Club” (“Go Home! Ootsurudani Go-Home Club”) is a Japanese manga series by Tanaka Catapult, first serialized in June 2024 via Kodansha’s manga app “Magazine Pocket” (マガポケ).

The story follows three high school girls at Ootsuruya High School who don't join any official after-school clubs. Instead, they form the “Go-Home Club,” making their journey home from school a stage for mischief, exploration, and emotional growth. The main character, Sasamorikaede, is a new student who quickly gets swept into this chaotic but heartwarming daily routine.

h4. External links

* "Official Twitter":https://twitter.com/KaereKitakubu
other_names: 帰れ!大鶴谷帰宅倶楽部

title: kannazuki_no_miko
body:
[b]Kannazuki no Miko[/b] (lit. [i][[miko|Priestesses]] of the Godless Month[/i]) is a manga series created by the duo [[Kaishaku]]. The series was serialized in fourteen chapters by [i]Kadokawa Shoten[/i] and in [i]Shounen Ace[/i] in 2004 and 2005, and collected in two bound volumes. The series was adapted as an anime television series broadcast in 12 episodes on [i]TNK[/i] between October and December 2004. A drama CD was released on November 25, 2004 by [i]Geneon[/i] based on the anime version.

The series centers on the [[yuri]] relationship of the two main characters, [[kurusugawa_himeko|Himeko]] and [[himemiya_chikane|Chikane]], with elements of [[magical girl]] and [[mecha]] themes helping to carry the plot. An anime series that includes several characters similar to those of [i]Kannazuki no Miko[/i] called [i][[Kyoushirou to Towa no Sora]][/i] aired in Japan between January and March 2007.

Because it was one of the first yuri romances in an anime that was played as a straight romance, it's become iconic for yuri romance, especially its ED artwork, featuring the memetic [[miko embrace]].  (The pose is essentially synonymous with yuri.)

The manga and anime were originally released in English under the original Japanese title by Tokyopop and Geneon USA respectively. After Geneon USA's shutdown, distribution rights for the anime were transferred to Sentai Filmworks, who now distribute the series under the English title [b]Destiny of the Shrine Maiden[/b].

title: marx_(kirby)
body:
The main antagonist and final boss in [[Kirby Super Star]] and its remake, [[Kirby Super Star Ultra]]. Marx tricked [[Kirby]] into finding [[Galactic Nova]] so he could make his wish to have ultimate power and take over Popstar. This causes him to turn into [[Marx (true form) (Kirby)|his true form]]. After his defeat, he returns in The True Arena as [[Marx Soul]], the last of the Final Four in said sub-game.

He makes a return in [[Kirby: Star Allies]] as a Dream Friend. He is part of the first wave of post-launch Dream Friends alongside [[Rick_(kirby)|]], [[Kine_(kirby)|]], [[Coo_(kirby)|]], and [[Gooey (kirby)|]].

He also appears as a boss in [[super_smash_bros.|Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]].

h4. External links

* "Kirby Wiki: Marx":[http://kirby.wikia.com/wiki/Marx]

title: marx_(true_form)_(kirby)
body:
The true form of [[Marx (Kirby)|]] from [i][[Kirby Super Star]][/i]. Marx sprouts golden wings with hexagon crystals, often having smaller [[slit pupils]] that [[wall-eyed|point in different directions]]. His true form may also have paler skin, larger shoes, and a thinner bowtie.

In [i][[Kirby Super Star Ultra]][/i], he gains an additional form known as [[Marx Soul]].

title: kiana_kaslana_(ba-dum!_fiery_wishing_star)
body:
One of the playable [[official alternate costume|battlesuits]] of [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]'s [[Kiana Kaslana]]. Released for the game's ninth anniversary in February 2025, it is Kiana's sole Part 2 battlesuit. 

It is composed of a [[white dress]] with [[detached sleeves]], red [[detached collar]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[black corset]]-like outer wear with red accents, white [[thigh strap]] on her right leg, and two-color [[red boots|red]]-[[black boots]]. 

[b]Important note[/b]: While she is portrayed in her [[kiana kaslana (herrscher of finality)|Herrscher of Finality]] form due to her purple [[diamond-shaped pupils]], she is not to be tagged as such since both are treated as separate battlesuits.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8762716: Profile

title: kiana_kaslana_(herrscher_of_finality)
body:
One of the playable [[official alternate costume|battlesuits]] of [[Honkai Impact 3rd]]'s [[Kiana Kaslana]]. Released in December 2022, this is the last of Kiana's battlesuits to be revealed for the game's Part 1.

In her original Herrscher of Finality form, she is portrayed with [[blue eyes]] with pink [[diamond-shaped pupils]]. Her outfit consists of an elaborate [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[white dress]] adorned with multiple [[black flower]]s, [[frills|frilled]] arm pieces, single white [[thigh strap]] on her left leg, [[single sock|single]] [[white socks|white sock]] on her left, and [[white footwear|white shoes]]. 

Her [[Kiana Kaslana (APHO)|Post-Honkai]] version replaces the neck flowers with a proper [[detached collar]] while her dress changes to a [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] white-[[purple dress]] with white [[detached sleeves]]. Her tiara is likewise replaced with a black [[hairband]] tied to her left.  

Her [[official alternate hairstyle]] is a [[high ponytail]], while she gains additional [[blue hair|blue]]-[[purple hair|purple]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] in her Post-Honkai version.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6061177: Default, as revealed
* !post #8627092: [[Kiana Kaslana (APHO)|Post-Honkai version]]

* !post #6495719: [[Kiana Kaslana (Summer 2023)|2023 Swimsuit]]
* !post #6664577

title: kaguya_madoka
body:
[[Star Twinkle Precure]] character. Civilian identity of [[Cure Selene]].

Kaguya Madoka/Cure Selene, a third year middle school student who does her best to be ladylike. She is from a family with a storied history: her father works in the government and her mother is a world-famous pianist. She herself holds national championship titles in piano and archery. She also does flower arrangement and tea ceremony, and gets excellent grades. As the student council president, she is known as the "moon" of her school.

title: amamiya_elena
body:
[[Star Twinkle Precure]] character. Civilian identity of [[Cure Soleil]].

Amamiya Elena/Cure Soleil, a third year middle school student with a radiant smile. She is the most popular girl in school, to the point where she is known as the school's "sun." She lives at a flower shop in the town's shopping district, where she sometimes works, and has six younger brothers and sisters whom she often takes care of in place of her busy parents.

title: hoshina_hikaru
body:
[[Star Twinkle Precure]] character. Civilian identity of [[Cure Star]].

Hoshina Hikaru/Cure Star, a second year middle school girl who loves the stars and constellations. She is full of imagination and curiosity. She investigates anything that interests her thoroughly, and acts on intuition.

title: amane_kanata
body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s [[holoForce|4th generation]]. Designed by [[Oshioshio]].

She has [[purple eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[colored inner hair]] and a few [[pink hair|pink]] [[streaked hair|streaks]]. Her default hairstyle is an [[asymmetrical hair|asymmetrical]] [[bob cut]] with a [[single hair intake]] and long [[asymmetrical bangs]] [[hair over one eye|covering her right eye]]. She also has [[mini wings|small]] [[gradient wings|gradient]] [[feathered wings|feathered]] [[angel wings]] going from [[white wings|white]] to [[blue wings|blue]] and a [[star halo|star-shaped halo]] (which is sometimes compared to a shuriken) floating off-center over her head.

title: golden_week
body:
April 29 to May 5.

In 1948, Japan introduced three (later four) public holidays during this week, making it a "golden time" for high recreational activity. It has since been further commercialized with promotional events and sales.

In 2021, artists began a trend of drawing characters in [[gold bikini]]s during Golden Week (beginning with post #4494511).

h4. See also

* [[Kodomo no Hi]] - public holiday in Japan on May 5

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Golden Bikini Week":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/events/golden-bikini-week]
* "Wikipedia: Golden Week (Japan)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golden_Week_(Japan)]

title: hamakaze_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Hamakaze[/i]. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] with [[hair over one eye|her bangs covering her right eye]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit is the uniform exclusive to her and the 17th Destroyer Division: a [[white shirt]] top with blue trim and [[blue sailor collar]], [[yellow neckerchief]], [[white gloves]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[brown pantyhose]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a single hull piece to her back containing both her funnels, foremast, and a 12.7 cm twin gun mount, 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s, and a second 12.7 cm twin mount and 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]] as [[handgun]]s. 

Due to similarities in appearance, she is frequently compared to characters from other franchises, including [[Mash Kyrielight]] from [[Fate/Grand Order]], [[Rem (re:zero)|]] from [[Re:Zero Kara Hajimeru Isekai Seikatsu]] and occasionally [[Konpaku Youmu]] from [[Touhou]] and [[2B (Nier:Automata)|]] from [[Nier:Automata]].

title: kyokutei_bakin_(fate)
body:
Rider-class Servant introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Nanmei Yumihari Hakkenden]] event. The pen name of [b]Takizawa Bakin[/b], a novelist from the Edo period who wrote [i]The Eight Dog Chronicles[/i] and [i]Strange Tales of the Crescent Moon[/i]. However, Fate's Bakin is actually summoned in his daughter-in-law [b]Tokimura Michi[/b]'s body, similar to what happens with his contemporary [[Katsushika Hokusai (fate)|]]. In her third ascension, she transforms into [b]Fusehime[/b] from [i]Eight Dog Chronicles[/i], and is accompanied by Yatsufusa.

Her [[dog ears]] and [[dog tail]] are just [[fake animal ears|part of]] [[fake tail|a costume]].

title: chrono_genesis_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i]. Voiced by Manase Hiyori.


The history buff/horse girl racing otaku uma. A small, seemingly mild-mannered horse girl who loves studying history. She particularly loves race histories, especially the interplay of the actions and dreams of the numerous horse girls and their trainer. Anticipating the potential results, every week, she goes off to the racecourses with a big camera in hand.

As she is practically a horse (girl) racing otaku, she is sometimes paired with [[Agnes Digital (umamusume)|]], who is a "Umamusume-chan" otaku, a fan of the horse girls themselves. The big camera aspect is often interpreted as a [[single-lens_reflex_camera|SLR]] with an oversized [[telephoto lens]].

title: chevrolet_camaro
body:
The Chevrolet Camaro is a mid-size American automobile manufactured by Chevrolet, classified as a pony car. 
It first went on sale on September 29, 1966, for the 1967 model year and was designed as a competing model to the Ford Mustang. 
The Camaro shared its platform and major components with the Firebird, produced by General Motors' Pontiac division that was also introduced for 1967.
Four distinct generations of the Camaro were developed before production ended in 2002. The nameplate was revived on a concept car that evolved into the fifth-generation Camaro; production started on March 16, 2009.

h4. Generations

title: asterix
body:
Asterix (French: Astérix or Astérix le Gaulois [asteʁiks lə ɡolwa], "Asterix the Gaul"; also known as Asterix and Obelix in some adaptations or The Adventures of Asterix) is a French comic album series about a Gaulish village which, thanks to a magic potion that enhances strength, resists the forces of [[Julius Caesar]]'s Roman Republic Army in a nonhistorical telling of the time after the Gallic Wars. Many adventures take the titular hero [[Asterix_(Character)|]] and his friend [[Obelix]] to Rome and beyond. 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asterix

title: zhang_jue_(fate)
body:
A Caster-class servant introduced in the [[Traum (fate/grand order)|]] singularity. He was the leader of the Yellow Turban rebellion detailed in the [[Romance of the Three Kingdoms]]. His name can also be read as Zhang Jiao.

In Traum, he appears as the military strategist for the Revenge Realm, working directly under [[Kriemhild (fate)|]]. [spoiler]In actuality, he is the mastermind behind the whole singularity, having been summoned by [[Specimen E]] to orchestrate it. To manage this, he creates [[clone]]s of himself while leaving his true body at [[Area 51]] to avoid the destruction of the singularity in the result of his death.[/spoiler]

[b]True Name:[/b] "Zhang Jue":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhang_Jue

title: constantine_xi_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]]’s depiction of [[Constantine XI|Constantine XI Palaiologos]], introduced in the 2022 [[15-nin no Richiteki na Megane-tachi]] event under the alias "Michael". He was released as a Rider-class servant in the [[Traum (fate/grand order)|]] chapter. His name is localized as [b]Konstantinos XI[/b].

The final emperor of [[Byzantine empire|Byzantium]] before the [[Ottoman Empire]] captured Constantinople, he was famous for holding out against the prolonged siege and defending the city until his final breath. There is a legend surrounding Constantine called the Marble Emperor, where he purportedly turned to stone, unable to bear to look at the beloved seat of his empire falling to the enemy. He is also commonly considered to be the last Roman emperor, on the courtesy of Byzantium having evolved from the Eastern [[Roman Empire]].

He is the leader of the Reinstatement Realm in [[Traum (fate/grand order)|]]. During the singularity, he falls in love with [[Johanna (fate)|]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Kurahana Chinatsu]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Kamio Shin'ichirou]]

title: obelix
body:
Obelix I (French: Obélix) is the deuteragonist of the [[Asterix]] franchise. He works as a menhir sculptor and deliveryman, and is [[Asterix_(Character)|Asterix's]] best friend. Obelix is noted for his obesity, the menhirs he carries around on his back and his superhuman strength. He is the only Gaul in Asterix' village who is always strong since he fell into the cauldron with magic potion when he was a small boy. Because of Obelix' already enormous strength he is not allowed to drink the magic potion ever again, much to his chagrin. Other characteristics are his simple-mindedness, his love and care for his dog Dogmatix, his anger when someone refers to him as being "fat", his enthusiasm for hunting and eating wild boars and beating up Romans. His catch phrase is: "These Romans are crazy", although usually he considers other nationalities just as strange.
* !post #7593728: Asterix on the right Obelix on the left

https://asterix.fandom.com/wiki/Obelix

title: moon_gundam
body:
[b][i]Mobile Suit Moon Gundam[/i][/b] (機動戦士MOONガンダム, 機動戦士ムーンガンダム) is a 2017 [[Gundam]] manga written by Fukui Harutoshi with art by [[Kosai Takayuki]]. 

It is published in [[Gundam Ace]] magazine by Kadokawa and is currently ongoing.

The manga is set in a [[space_station|space colony]] during the Universal Century and the events of [[Zeta Gundam]] and [[Gundam ZZ]].

title: jeddah_(mobile_suit)
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from [[Gundam]]. It appears in the [[Moon Gundam]] manga from 2017.

[b] RGM-88X Jeddah [/b]

An experimental prototype for the Federation's next generation mass produced [[mobile_suit|MS]] to replace the outdated [[GM III]]. The Jeddah's specifications were considered adequate, with even [[Amuro Ray]] giving his seal of approval for the design to be passed onwards, and as such it was further refined and simplified into the venerable [[Jegan]].

h4. Related development
* [[Jeddah Cannon]]

title: psycho_doga
body: A fictional manned combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

title: geara_zulu
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Gundam Unicorn]].

[b]AMS-129 Geara Zulu[/b]

The successor to the [[Geara Doga]] [[mobile_suit|MS]] - cheap, reliable and easy to produce and pilot, in line with its distant ancestor, the [[Zaku]]. Its head has been redesigned and resembles a [i][[Stahlhelm]][/i] with a gas mask shaped vent, and its improved beam machine gun seems heavily inspired by the [[StG 44]]. 

While not cutting edge by any stretch of the imagination, it's still a serviceable, solid MS for [[Full Frontal]]'s Sleeves - his personal brand of [[Neo Zeon]].

title: kuzuryu_fuyuhiko
body:
A character from [[danganronpa_2:_goodbye_despair|Super Danganronpa 2]], titled the Ultimate [[Yakuza]] (超高校級の「極道家」)

Kuzuryuu has [[blonde hair|blond hair]], [[yellow eyes]], [[freckles]], and [[blush stickers]]. He usually wears a [[vertical stripes|vertically striped]] [[suit]] and sometimes a [[hat]].

He is the brother of [[Kuzuryu Natsumi]].

title: charlemagne_(fate)
body:
One of the playable characters in [[Fate/EXTELLA LINK]]. Looks a lot like [[Fujimaru Ritsuka (male)|the male protagonist]] from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Charlemagne was incorporated into FGO as a playable Saber-class Servant during the [[Traum (fate/grand order)|]] chapter. His [[Charlemagne (Third Ascension) (fate)|third ascension]] is locked until players complete Traum.

[b]True Name:[/b] Charlemagne, King of Franks and Leader of the 12 Paladins. Specifically, this is the incarnation of the fantasy stories surrounding Charlemagne, whereas [[Karl Der Grosse (fate)|]] is the real Charlemagne as he was in life.
[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]], [[Wada Arco]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Kimura Ryouhei]]

title: tsukuyomi_sena
body:
Tsukuyomi Sena is a collaborative [[UTAU]] voicebank created by users of the English-speaking anonymous [[imageboard]] [[39chan]]. They are a shapeshifting [[alien]] taking on the form of an [[androgynous]] human. Progress on the voicebank would begin on September 22, 2024 with [[28lane]] providing the initial concept designs (and later final artwork). An user named Lynx would later become Sena's voice provider. The voicebank was finished in February 20, 2025.

Their character item is [[surstromming]].

title: toriko_(39chan)
body:
A collaborative voicebank created by users of the imageboard [[39chan]] for [[april fools]] in 2025. TORIKO is a 23-year old girl female idol dressed in [[jirai kei]] fashion with two black [[hair bow|hair bows]] and [[twintails]], her left eye is [[hair over one eye|covered by her own hair]]. Progress on her started on January 2, 2025 with a DiffSinger AI voicebank announced on April 1st. However, this voicebank would be delayed, resulting in an UTAU one being created and released on April 27 instead. Her official artwork was illustrated by [[Melonenbrot]].

title: geese_howard
body:
A recurring villain of [[SNK]]'s [[Fatal Fury]], [[Ryuuko no Ken|Art of Fighting]], and [[The King of Fighters]] series.

Famed as crime lord of South Town, leader of the Howard Connection syndicate, and wielder of Hakkyokuseiken and other powerful martial arts. He suffered a hard childhood, including a grievous encounter with his half-brother [[Wolfgang Krauser]]. Geese trained in Hakkyokuseiken under [[Tung Fue Rue|Tung Fu Rue]] alongside Jeff Bogard and [[Cheng Sinzan]], though he would be banished by Tung after Geese rebelled when Jeff was named the heir to the style and the darkness in his heart was recognized.

Early in his criminal career, Geese posed as the police chief of South Town while ruling the city's underworld; to force resident karate master [[Takuma Sakazaki]] under his thumb, he enlisted [[Mr Big (SNK)|Mr. Big]] to kidnap Takuma's daughter [[Yuri Sakazaki|Yuri]]. After the kidnapping plot was foiled, Geese would become more hands-on in his operations before he was defeated and ran out of town by Takuma's son [[Ryou Sakazaki|Ryo Sakazaki]] and his friend [[Robert Garcia]]. The defeat was so severe that Geese was forced to retool his martial arts before returning to South Town years later and finally slaying his rival Jeff Bogard. From that moment forever onward, Geese served as mortal enemy of Jeff's adopted sons, the Bogard brothers [[Terry Bogard|Terry]] and [[Andy Bogard|Andy]]. He is also the illegitimate biological father of [[Rock Howard]]. [[Billy Kane]] is his personal bodyguard and closest confidant.

As of current, Geese is declared dead in the Art of Fighting/Fatal Fury continuity, after falling from his tower during a final showdown with Terry in the finale of Real Bout Fatal Fury; any post-death appearances of Geese are either non-canon or referred to as the otherworldly phantom of nightmares, [b]Nightmare Geese[/b]. In [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], Nightmare Geese - in a variant of his Fatal Fury 1 outfit - is the secret final boss of arcade mode, while certain characters encounter him as the final boss in the Episodes of South Town story mode, in a sort of final exorcism of Geese's influence from South Town. In the King of Fighters continuity, he is still alive.

Voiced primarily by Kong Kuwata, he is infamous for his [[Engrish text|Engrish]] quotes across numerous titles, his noted penchant for falling out of buildings, his fascination with Japanese culture as a [[blonde hair|blonde haired]], [[blue eyes|blue eyed]] American, and his relatively consistent theme song. When he's not wearing a nice suit, he is almost always fighting wearing a [[red hakama]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geese_Howard]
* "SNK Wiki article":[https://snk.fandom.com/wiki/Geese_Howard]

title: barack_obama
body:
[b]Barack Hussein Obama II[/b] (b. 4 August 1961) is an American [[politician]] who served as 44th president of the [[United States|United States of America]] from [[2009]] to [[2017]]. A member of the Democratic Party, he was the first African-American president in American history. Obama previously served as a U.S. senator representing Illinois and as an Illinois state senator. 

Born in Honolulu, [[Hawaii]], Obama graduated from Columbia University in [[1983]] with a Bachelor of Arts degree in political science and later worked as a community organizer in Chicago. In [[1988]], Obama enrolled in Harvard Law School, where he was the first black president of the Harvard Law Review. He became a [[lawyer|civil rights attorney]] and an academic, teaching constitutional law at the University of Chicago Law School from [[1992]] to [[2004]]. In [[1996]], Obama was elected to represent the 13th district in the Illinois Senate, a position he held until [[2004]], when he successfully ran for the U.S. Senate. In the [[2008 presidential election]], after a close primary campaign against [[Hillary Clinton]], he was nominated by the Democratic Party for president. Obama selected [[Joe Biden]] as his running mate and defeated Republican nominee [[John McCain]] and his running mate [[Sarah Palin]]. He became popular in Japan in part due to the fact that he shares his last name with a city in the Fukui prefecture.

* !asset #25713339: 2012 inaugural portrait

Use this tag whenever President Obama is shown, or for works which imply his famous "Hope" or "Change" campaign posters, or for his campaign phrase, "Yes we can".

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:People]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barack_Obama]

title: metal_gear_survive
body:
A non-canon instalment in the Metal Gear franchise released in 2018, and is the first game in the series since the NES ports not to be produced by Hideo Kojima.

When announced in 2016, the game received bad reception from shifting the series into a survival horror setting instead of the political espionage it was known for. When the game was released, more flaws were discovered, such as paying for save slots and reused assets from the previous game.

title: roland_(fate)
body:
Saber-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]], first briefly seen during [[Astolfo (fate)|]]'s Interlude and later made playable during the release of [[Traum (fate/grand order)|]]. He is infamous for an incident where he was rejected by a woman, so he threw off his clothes and ran around [[nude]]. Astolfo [[crossdressing|dressed as a woman]] to appease and calm him down.

He wields the sword [[Durandal (fate)|]]. [[Hector (fate)|]] is his ancestor, and his cousins include Astolfo, [[Bradamante (fate)|]], and Rinaldo.

body:

title: justice_task_force_member_(blue_archive)
body:
A nameless female mob unit in [[Blue Archive]] who serves as a part of Trinity General School's [[Justice Task Force (blue archive)|]]. Despite her lack of distinctive characteristics she's managed to garner quite a following. For short she may be called 正実モブ ([i]Seiji Mobu[/i], "JTF Mob") or affectionately as モブちゃん ([i]Mob-chan[/i]).

The named members of the [[Justice Task Force (blue archive)|]] (with the exception of [[Koharu (blue archive)|]]) all share certain character design elements in common with Mob-chan. [[Ichika (blue archive)|]] is particularly close to them, both in terms of appearance and being most likely to interact directly with them. This has lead to a common joke that Mob-chan represents a "base form" that the other members have "evolved" from. As of Ichika's recent release, these mobs have [[red eyes]].

Carries either an [[EM-2]] or an [[L85]]-style [[assault rifle]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #9082226: Default (version from ToSchool)
other_names: 正義実現委員会のモブ

title: hex_maniac_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Occult Mania[/b] (Japanese), [b]Hex Maniac[/b] (English)

A female-only trainer class in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] games. While they first debuted in [i][[pokemon_rse|RSE]][/i], their later appearance in [i][[pokemon_xy|XY]][/i] was much more popular. They specialize in Ghost-type and Psychic-type Pokémon.

Occasionally paired with the [[fairy_tale_girl_(pokemon)|Fairy Tale Girl]] due to an in-game trainer pair called the Mysterious Sisters. In [i]XY[/i], a Hex Maniac sells [[Moomoo Milk]].

h5. Appearance

h6. [i]Pokémon Ruby, Sapphire, and Emerald[/i] (Generation III)

See [[Hex Maniac (Pokemon RSE)]].

h6. [i]Pokémon X, Y, Omega Ruby, and Alpha Sapphire[/i] (Generation VI)

* !post #4993502: Hex Maniac as she appeared in Gen 6 games.

Most fanart is based on their later appearance which debuted in [i][[pokemon_xy|XY]][/i] and later reappeared in [i][[pokemon_oras|ORAS]][/i].

They appear as young [[mojyo|mojyo]] girls wearing a [[long dress|long]] [[black dress]], having [[@_@|swirly manic eyes]], and [[messy hair]] with a [[purple hairband]]. [i]Very[/i] commonly drawn with an [[alternate breast size]] favoring increased cup size.

h4. See also

* [[Hex Maniac (Prototype) (Pokemon)|]]
* [[List of Pokemon trainer classes]]

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: Hex Maniac (Trainer class)":http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Hex_Maniac_%28Trainer_class%29

body:

Due to the general design and color scheme many suspect it to be the [[Hex Maniac_(pokemon)|]] trainer class.

This is a tentative tag and will be subject to change when more information becomes available.

* !asset #25101994: (AI upscaled)

title: yume_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Former president of the Abydos High School Student Council. Her full name is Kuchinashi Yume.

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[aqua hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and [[large breasts]]. She wears an Abydos High School uniform with no jacket and a [[chest harness]], quite similar to the uniform Hoshino wears as a third-year student. Her [[halo]] is shaped like the Abydos logo.

Often depicted together with a [[hoshino (first year) (blue archive)|younger Hoshino]].

Voiced by [[Fuchigami Mai]] ([[blue archive the animation|anime]]).

h4. Appearance

* !post #7195180: Default
* !asset #22788685: [[Abydos High School Swimsuit]]

h4. External links

* "Blue Archive Wiki: Kuchinashi Yume":https://bluearchive.fandom.com/wiki/Kuchinashi_Yume
other_names: ユメ(ブルーアーカイブ)

title: mizuki_(arknights)
body:
[i]Landship observation target Mizuki, latent threat principally confirmed low at the present stage.[/i]

A playable Specialist Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Higashi[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]March 22[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Ægir[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]161 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A somewhat mysterious boy who came to Rhodes Island after the events of Dossoles Holiday. While cute and honest, his jumbled past and unusual Arts mean there may be more to him than meets the eye.

Mizuki is a side character in [i]Dossoles Holiday[/i] and is the protagonist of the third season of Integrated Strategies, [i]Mizuki and Caerula Arbor[/i].

Subject to similar [[otoko no ko]] depictions as [[Ansel (arknights)|]].

His motif is based on Moon Jellyfish.

His [[voice actor]] is [[Murase Ayumu]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6064024: [[mizuki_(summer_feast)_(arknights)|Summer Feast]]

* !post #9243063: [[mizuki_(a_player_forever)_(arknights)|A Player Forever]]

body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Mizuki (Arknights)|]] of [[Arknights]].

title: hyrule_warriors:_age_of_calamity
body:
A sequel to [[Hyrule Warriors]]. Unlike its predecessor, this installment is a prequel to [[The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild|Breath of the Wild]] and tells the events that occurred during the Calamity period 100 years prior to the game.

h4. See also

* [[Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment]]

title: satou_(danganronpa)
body:
[[Danganronpa (series)|]] character.

A Reserve Course student and [[Koizumi Mahiru]]'s close friend. She initially appears in [[Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair]] as "Girl E" during the Twilight Syndrome game, but is later shown properly in [[Danganronpa 3 (anime)|]].

title: saber_(learning_with_manga!_fgo)
body:
One of the original servants in [[Riyo (lyomsnpmp)|]]'s ""Learn Even More with Manga! FGO":[/pools/10385]". He first appeared in post #3480508.

Saber is the [b]unborn baby[/b] inside the womb (who does all the talking), NOT the mother (who's always silent for some reason). He speaks like an old man and loves to flirt with women.

title: paul_bunyan_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]] character.

One of the original servants in [[Riyo (lyomsnpmp)|]]'s ""Learn More with Manga! FGO":[/pools/10385]". She first appeared in post #2609209. She is based on the [[giant]] lumberjack from American folklore with the same name.

Was officially added to the game on August 2, 2017, with the [[All the Statesmen!]] event.

title: daikokuten_(fate)
body:
Caster-class servant appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. They were one of the original servants in [[Riyo (lyomsnpmp)|]]'s ""Learn Even More with Manga! FGO":[/pools/10385]". They first appeared in post #3459404. Rather than being the god himself, they are envoys sent on his behalf.

They appear as several [[dark-skinned female|dark-skinned]] [[mouse girl]]s in matching uniforms, with anywhere from two to thirty manifesting depending on how much magical energy is provided. The main two individuals are known as [b]No. 1[/b] and [b]No. 2[/b]. No. 1 has [[blue hair]] in a [[bob cut]], while No. 2 has [[pink hair]] in [[short twintails]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Riyo (lyomsnpmp)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Takeda Hana]]

title: grand_theft_auto_vi
body:
[b]Grand Theft Auto VI[/b] is an action-adventure video game being developed by "Rockstar Games":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rockstar_Games. 

The game's setting marks the return of Miami-inspired Vice City, and has been expanded into the fictional open world state of Leonida, based on the state of [[Florida (location)|]], [[United States]]. The game was formally revealed on 5 December 2023 and was originally set to be released sometime in 2025 for the [[Xbox Series X|Xbox Series X/S]] and [[Playstation 5]]. However, on 2 May 2025, it was announced the game will be delayed and instead will be release next year on May 2026.

h4. See also
* [[Grand Theft Auto]]
* [[Grand Theft Auto: Vice City]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Grand Theft Auto VI":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grand_Theft_Auto_VI
* "The official Grand Theft Auto VI Trailer 1 on YouTube":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QdBZY2fkU-0

title: honk_honk_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originating from [[4chan]] which developed in two ways, though typically associated with [[Touhou]]'s [[Chen]] today.

The earlier of the two was based on the episodes titled "The Alien Costume" from [[Spider-Man: The Animated Series]]. In Part 3 (Episode 9), Spider-Man attempts to escape by jumping on a train, causing Eddie Brock (as [[Venom (Marvel)|]]) to steal a truck and ride alongside the train, honking the truck horn. This version of the meme would merge into the later and more popular of the two, inspired by the first Touhou comic drawn by [[bkub]], post #244234, which featured Chen honking the horn of a bicycle.

On 4chan, this would inspire crossover art with Venom honking the horn of a bicycle instead of a truck, before the Venom meme faded entirely in favor of the Chen meme.

title: ayane_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Secretary of the [[Foreclosure Task Force (blue archive)|]]. Her full name is Okusora Ayane.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with a [[crown braid]] decorated with a [[hair flower]], [[yellow eyes]] and [[pointy ears]]. She wears [[red-framed eyewear|red-framed]] [[glasses]] and has a [[red halo]]. Her default outfit is a [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[blue jacket|blue]] [[blazer]] with an [[armband]] and an [[id card]], a [[yellow vest|yellow]] [[sweater vest]] a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], an [[aqua necktie]], a [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] and [[black shoes|black]] [[loafers]].

Her personal weapon is a [[Sig P228/P229|SIG P229]] and she can deploy a [[drone]].

Voiced by: [[Harada Sayaka]]
Original artist: [[hwansang]]

title: yamaha_pacifica
body:
Line of solid-body [[electric guitar]]s designed and manufactured by Japanese maker [[Yamaha]] since 1989. 

Its original and now-classic inception is based on [[fender_musical_instruments_corporation|Fender]]'s [[Fender Stratocaster]] with the main differences being a much rounder body with longer horns, a different headstock with Yamaha's logo, a distinctly shaped smaller pickguard on higher end models, and an output jack mounted on the side of the body instead of its front. 

h4. Common models
* !post #967039: PAC012/112J
* !post #3525427: PAC112V
* !post #6504241: PAC611VFM
* !post #6226082: PAC612VIIFM
* !post #9235648: PACS+12/PACP12


h4. See also

* [[Fender telecaster]]
* [[Fender jazzmaster]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

title: ushio_(kancolle)
body: [[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Ushio[/i]. Character design by [[Drew (drew213g)|]], voiced by [[Hayasaka Kozue]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with an [[ahoge]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Special Type's [[serafuku]] and [[black_socks|black]] [[kneehighs]]. Her [[cannon|12.7 cm twin gun mount]] is colored pink, and which has a [[:3]] face upon its top so that looking down at it, the cannon barrels look like ears on a bunny. She normally hugs her cannon tightly to her chest (to hide her chest, presumably). She has [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]] with a notable [[ahoge]]. The [[torpedo tubes]] strapped to her thighs have puppy, kitty, bunny, and other cartoon animal [[sticker]]s on them. Her damaged CG reveals that she's hiding surprisingly [[large breasts]] for a destroyer/young girl. The reason for this may be that "Ushi" is the word for "cow", so she has "Ushi Oppai", or "cow tits", which is how some Japanese mock women with larger-than-normal cup sizes. Historically, the real-life [i]Ushio[/i] took part in many of the IJN's operations and was one of the extremely few surviving Japanese destroyers of [[World War II]], alongside only [[Yukikaze (kancolle)|]] and [[Hibiki (kancolle)|]] of the ships in the game. Also famous for being a "lucky" ship, she is unlike [[Yukikaze (Kancolle)|]] and [[Shigure (Kancolle)|]] in the sense that she protected her companions instead of jinxing them. h4. title: translated
body:
A post that has been fully translated into English. See [[translation request]] for untranslated posts.

This tag only applies to fully translated posts. If the translation is incomplete or needs review, use [[partially translated]] or [[check translation]] instead. When the post is fully translated, remove the [[translation request]] tag and add [[translated]].

Additionally, it's okay to leave out the [[translated]] tag on posts with very small and insubstantial notes, such as single onomatopoeia that could just as well go untranslated. Anything more substantial than that should be tagged [[translated]].

See [[howto:translate]] for guidelines on how to translate.

h4. Related tags

* [[alternate language]]
* [[check translation]]
* [[hard-translated]]
* [[hard-translated (non-english)]]
* [[partially translated]]
* [[poorly translated]]
** [[fake translation]]
* [[reverse translation]]
* [[translation note]]
* [[translation request]]

h4. See also

* [[about:note formatting]]

* [[howto:translate]]

title: sazanami_(kancolle)
body: [[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Sazanami[/i], and one of the five starter ships. Character design by [[Drew (drew213g)|]], voiced by [[Hayasaka Kozue]]. She has [[pink eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[pink hair]] in [[twintails]] held with [[hair bobbles]]. On her lower right waist is a round [[badge]] with a strawberry-like pattern. When heavily damaged, she is revealed to be wearing [[strawberry print]] [[strawberry panties|panties]]. She has a tiny pink [[rabbit]] companion. The 7th Destroyer Division (Sazanami, [[Akebono (kancolle)|]], [[Ushio (kancolle)|]] and [[Oboro (kancolle)|]]) all wear a variant of the Fubuki-class standard [[serafuku]] as well as dark green versions of the Fubuki-class ship parts and rigging. She talks in random pop-culture references, memes and internet slang and refers to the [[Admiral (kancolle)|]] as "master" as if she was a [[maid]] in a [[maid cafe]] (her new remodel CG emphasizes this point). h4. title: oboro_(kancolle)
body: [[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Oboro[/i]. Character design by [[Drew (drew213g)|]], voiced by [[Hayasaka Kozue]]. She has [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. Her default outfit is the Special Type's [[serafuku]] ([[white shirt]], [[blue sailor collar]], [[blue skirt]]), and a [[bandaid]] on [[bandaid_on_face|her cheek]]. Her [[rigging]] is also shared with the rest of the Special Types: a funnel backpack, 12.7 cm twin gun mount, and 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. Her real-life counterpart had a problem with [[crab]]s getting into her, so her official art shows a crab peeking out of her smokestack. She is frequently depicted in fanart having the crab with her 24/7 such as on her [[animal on head|head]] or [[animal on shoulder|shoulder]] and treating it as a [[pet]]. Sometimes fanart will also depict crabs crawling out of her turrets when she least expects it. h4. title: ootomari_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese icebreaker/fleet oiler [i]Ootomari[/i]. Character design by [[Hozuka (kadokawa)|]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied to a [[braided ponytail]], and [[yellow eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white dress]] top, [[blue skirt]], [[blue cloak]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[grey shoes|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a miniature version of the real-life ship to her right side and held at waist-level, and a [[briefcase]]. She uses a 76 mm [[handgun]] mount at kai form, reflective of her wartime duties.

title: akebono_(kancolle)
body: [[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Akebono[/i]. Character design by [[Drew (drew213g)|]], voiced by [[Hayasaka Kozue]]. She has [[purple eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]] in a [[side ponytail]], plus a [[hair flower]] and [[hair bell]]. Her default outfit is shared with the other Special Types, consisting of a [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] shirt and [[blue_skirt|blue]] [[pleated_skirt]]. She also typically wears [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] and [[loafers]] outside of her combat gear. Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnel-mast set worn like a backpack, a handheld 12.7 cm twin gun mount, and carried over a shoulder strap. Her shoes are armored, and she wears dual torpedo turrets on her thighs, like many in the [i]Fubuki-class[/i]. She refers to the [[Admiral (kancolle)|]] as a "[[Shitty Admiral_(phrase)|]]" and is seemingly always angry about something, stemming from her ill experiences during the war. In some fanworks, calling the admiral "shitty" is so ingrained in her, she even calls the admiral "shitty admiral" when she's in love, like other girls might say "darling". She's typically portrayed as a [[tsundere]] with almost no dere, at least not verbally, or a "bitter-tongued tsukkomi. Oftentimes, she's seen playing a big sister role to [[Ushio (kancolle)|]], who is often portrayed as the most childish and clumsy of the 7th Des Div. Along with the rest of the 7th DesDiv, Akebono has been one of the most frequent targets of limited-time special event artwork. h4. title: kimi_no_koto_ga_dai_dai_dai_dai_daisuki_na_100-nin_no_kanojo
body:
[i]Kimi no koto ga Dai Dai Dai Dai Daisuki na 100-nin no Kanojo[/i] ([i]The 100 Girlfriends Who Really, Really, Really, Really, Really Love You[/i]) is a harem romantic comedy manga written by Rikito Nakamura and illustrated by [[Nozawa Yukiko]]. It began serialization on December 26, 2019.

It follows high school student [[Aijou Rentarou]], who in his lifetime fell in love and confessed to exactly 100 girls, only to be rejected by all of them. While praying in a shrine, Rentarou is approached by the God of Love, who reveals that he, due to an error, is destined to have 100 soulmates. However, he also tells Rentarou that if he does not return the feelings of any of his soulmates, they will suffer an accident and die. Not wanting this to happen, Rentarou is determined not to let any of his soulmates die as he meets and dates them all at the same time.

title: kinugasa_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the second of the two ships of the [i]Aoba[/i]-class cruisers.

She has [[grey_hair|grey]]-[[pink hair]] tied up in [[short twintails]] with a pair of [[hair tie]]s, and [[green eyes]] in [[tsurime]] style.  She wears a standard [[serafuku]] with a yellow [[necktie]], a [[belt]], and dark brown [[thighhighs]]. When under medium damage, it is revealed she wears a [[yellow bra]] and [[side-tie panties]]. In her [[kinugasa kai ni (kancolle)|Kai Ni]] form she has a [[one side up]] hairstyle instead of twintails.

Her [[machinery|combat gear]] includes twin-[[cannon]] [[ship turret|turret]]s in each hand, the left significantly taller than the right, as well as a third turret strapped to her left thigh.  Strapped to her back like a backpack is a miniature replica of the original ship's bridge, with a [[crane (machine)|]] hanging off the back.  

She is a stereotypical energetic high school girl, but like many of the energetic destroyers or cruisers, she is mostly known (if she is known at all) as [[Aoba (kancolle)|]]'s less-popular younger sister, and is generally only seen in Aoba's company.

title: pyramid_of_khafre
body: One of the three principal [[ancient Egyptian]] pyramids at Giza, built as the tomb of the Fourth Dynasty Pharaoh Khafre (reigned ca. 2558–2532 BC), whose name is also somettimes rendered "Chephren" in English. The Pyramid of Khafre is slightly smaller than the [[great_pyramid_of_giza|Great Pyramid of Khufu]], his father, but looks larger from most angles because it stands on higher ground, so is often mistaken for the Great Pyramid in photo captions.  It is distinguishable by the fact that some of its smooth outer cladding still exists near the peak.

title: cinquedea
body: A type of broad, tapering [[short sword]] or large [[dagger]] used during the Italian renaissance in the 15th and 16th Centuries. 'Cinquedea' means 'five fingers,' which refers to the number of fullers (grooves in a blade to reduce weight) they often had, though some specimens have three or four.

title: jaguar
body:
The jaguar (Panthera onca), also known in South America as (painted) onça, is the only extant Panthera species native to the Americas.

The jaguar is the largest cat species in the Americas and the third-largest after the [[tiger]] and the [[lion]]. This spotted cat closely resembles the [[leopard]], but is usually larger and sturdier. It ranges across a variety of forested and open terrains, but its preferred habitat is tropical and subtropical moist broadleaf forest, swamps and wooded regions. The jaguar enjoys swimming and is largely a solitary, opportunistic, stalk-and-ambush predator at the top of the food chain. As a keystone species it plays an important role in stabilizing ecosystems and regulating prey populations.

The jaguar has an exceptionally powerful bite, even relative to the other big cats. Given its historical distribution, the jaguar has featured prominently in the mythology of numerous indigenous American cultures, including those of the Maya and Aztec.


h5. For characters with jaguar characteristics
* [[Jaguar girl]]
* [[Jaguar boy]]

title: kirby_(series)
body:
Video game series by [[Nintendo]] and [[HAL Laboratory]]. Known in Japan as [b]Hoshi no Kirby[/b] (Kirby of the Stars). Best known for its surprisingly dark lore despite the game's overall cute asthetics.

There is also an anime adaptation that goes by the same name in Japan. When it was dubbed in English, it was given another name: [[kirby:_right_back_at_ya|Kirby: Right Back At Ya!]]

This tag shares the same Pixiv tag with [[Kirby's Dream Land]]. Please keep this in mind when adding copyright tags for [i]Kirby[/i] art.

title: gashadokuro
body:
A mythical [[giant skeleton]] in modern Japanese mythology.

Gashadokuro, also known as Odokuro, or ("starving skeleton") are giant skeletons that are fifteen times taller than an average person. If a Gashadokuro sees a human, it will grab it and attempt to bite its head off with its giant teeth. Gashadokuro are created from gathering bones from people who have died of starvation. The only way a Gashadokuro can be detected before it appears is by hearing a ringing in one's ears.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25709964

h4. See also

* [[traditional youkai]]

title: hagoromo_lala
body:
[[Star Twinkle Precure]] character. Civilian identity of [[Cure Milky]].

Hagoromo Lala/Cure Milky, an alien from planet Samaan. She is 13 years old in Earth years, but she is treated as an adult on her home planet. She goes on a journey on a rocket with [[Prunce (precure)|]] and [[Fuwa (precure)|]] to find the legendary Precure, and ends up on Earth. She has a strong sense of responsibility, but sometimes makes mistakes.

Lala has short [[aqua hair|aqua]]/[[blue hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[aqua eyes|aqua]]/[[blue eyes]] with [[star-shaped pupils]]. Lala wears a [[yellow jacket|yellow]] [[cropped jacket]] with [[short sleeves]] and a [[blue sailor collar]], a [[necklace]], a [[white dress]], a [[single glove|single]] [[aqua gloves|aqua]] [[fingerless gloves|fingerless glove]], a [[blue belt]] with a [[belt pouch|pouch]] strapped to it, [[loose socks|loose]] [[yellow socks]] and [[shoes]].

title: minase_rio_(2nd_costume)
body:
The 2nd summer [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Holostars]]' [[Minase Rio]]. 

It is a sailor theme, sporting a black [[sailor shirt]] [[sailor hat|and hat]], [[black shorts]], [[black socks]], [[purple belt]], [[sweater jacket]], [[stud earrings]], and a [[white neckerchief]].

For his [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]], it is styled with [[braided bangs]] and a [[low ponytail]] to his left.

h4. Appearance

* !post #5565898: Profile

title: rinkou_ashelia_(3rd_costume)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Phase Connect]]'s [[Rinkou Ashelia]].

It's a [[tenshi kaiwai]]/[[punk]] inspired costume, consisting of [[fake wings|fake]] [[head wings]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[crop top]] with [[belt]]s forming a [[criss-cross halter]] and [[mismatched sleeves|mismatched]] [[detached sleeves]] (the left sleeve having [[black sleeves|black]] and [[white sleeves|white]] [[striped sleeves|stripes]] and the right being [[blue sleeves|blue]]), [[white bloomers]] with blue [[frills]] and a [[black belt]], [[torn leggings|torn]] and [[mismatched legwear|mismatched leggings]], [[white leg warmers]] with [[fake wings]] on the ankles and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[two-tone footwear|and]] [[white footwear|white]] [[sneakers]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has her hair cut in a [[wolf cut]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[short hair with long locks|chest-length locks]] and bangs [[hair over one eye|covering her left eye]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8388757: Reference sheet

title: prunechi
body:
[[Original]] character of the [[Arca.live]] / [[Ruliweb]] [[commission|commissioner]] "빘치":[https://arca.live/u/@%EB%B9%98%EC%B9%98]/"킹받네진짜":[https://bbs.ruliweb.com/timeline?user=3266638]. She's a custom character of the [[lyn (blade & soul)|Lyn]] race and Blade Dancer (린검사) class from the MMORPG [[Blade & Soul]]. However, her appearance differs from the common Lyn, and furthermore, she has been drawn by various artists in different styles, wearing costumes outside Blade & Soul, and with alternate proportions. Therefore, she's often considered a character on her own.

She has [[red eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], a [[cat tail]] and [[cat ears]] (though ears can be ambiguous [[animal ears]]), as well as three moles: [[mole under eye|under her eye]], [[mole on breast|on her breast]] and [[mole on thigh|on her thigh]]. Her main apparel consists of a [[cat ear hairband]], an [[animal collar]] with a [[neck bell|bell]], an [[off shoulder]] [[red jacket]], a [[white one-piece swimsuit]], matching [[white thighhighs]], and a pair of [[red shoes|red]] [[nike (company)|Nike]] [[Air Jordan 1]]'s. She also often wears a [[cow print bikini]], with matching [[cow print thighhighs|thighhighs]] and [[cow print gloves|gloves]], as well as a [[cowbell]] and [[ear tag]].

h4. External links

* "빘치's posts on Ruliweb's commission board":[https://bbs.ruliweb.com/userboard/board/700051?search_type=member_srl&search_key=3266638]

title: hot_ones
body: [b]Hot Ones[/b] is an American [[YouTube]] talk show hosted by [[Sean Evans]] and produced by First We Feast. Notable for having celebrity guests getting interviewed by Evans while also eating ten [[Chicken wing]]s (or substitutes based on the guests dietary habits(eg. vegetarian chicken for Vegetarian guests or beef slices for [[Bear Grylls]])) with ten different [[hot sauce]]s of increasing Scoville levels.
